Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient LAX hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natalie B
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to LAX; we were able to return our rental car and walk back easily to the hotel. There is a shuttle that serves this and another hotel that runs every 20-30 minutes. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Service was top notch; the front desk clerk gave us a room that was quiet but had a view for the little ones and also sent up complimentary milk and cookies for them. The bell man was very helpful with tips and also got us extra towels for the kids, unasked. Very friendly, clean and comfortable with clean, modern decor. I would highly recommend this as a great airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: YS1_11
Reviews.Content: A very good stay in Los Angeles Airport. The hotel is comfortable and clean; service is good and the parking was free (with booking through Expedia) and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stop over.”
Reviews.Author: Eternal_Howl
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for a night in between flights. My husband had called ahead and requested a crib for our daughter. After catching the complimentary shuttle from LAX at the courtesy shuttle stand at the airport, when we arrived we had our four large suitcases escorted to our room upon check-in. The crib was set up in our room, per request. The hotel was tidy and the room decent. My only complaint about the room was there was no extractor fan in the bathroom.Therefore, after showering, the mirrors were all steamed up. We settled down to sleep, but it sounded like a party was going on next door. A quick phone call to the front desk saw our neighbours go quiet, but then the other side started, so another phone call and they also quietened down within about 20 minutes. I had difficulty sleeping, due to being outside my time zone (my 4-month-old daughter and myself had travelled internationally) and while my husband and daughter slept well, I was up most of the night and spent much of that time in the lobby talking to one of the staff. Another staff member offered me a complimentary copy of the LA Times to help while away the hours. The bar was closed at this odd hour and the Burger King across the road had closed at 1am, but one of the lobby staff advised me of soda vending machines on each floor. Wile I would have preferred a hot beverage, at least he was kind enough to alert me to this. Check-out was a breeze and we had no wait to catch the courtesy shuttle back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tobjo282
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a half dozen times over last few years and have always found it to be a quality hotel. Rooms are clean and updated and include a safe in the closet. Very close to LAX airport makes it convenient for early morning departures. Quality windows keep traffic and aircraft noise to acceptable levels. Nice gym and pool area. Lobby area has this funky new age music playing that is to loud and annoying. The bath towels on this last trip seemed thin and worn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not too close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: BPreston310
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this location for years. Even after moving to LA, it is a great hotel if you have an early morning flight. Avoiding bad traffic is always the right play in this town. The valets are always pleasant as is the front desk team. Check in prompt and without issue. They gave me a quiet room on the back side of the hotel and away from the elevators. Room was very clean and modern, but is getting close to being time to remodel. The bed was spectacular and the sheets were the high quality you would expect at this brand. Newer flat-screen TV with access to a wide variety of shows in several languages. I did not use the VOD, but the content is usually current and quite good. Room service was delivered promptly the next morning and was very good. I will say to any hotel still charging for Internet to get with the times. About the only negative thing to say about this location. Tip of the day: You can book parking online or bundle parking with the hotel. I found online VALET for around $10.00 per day. Sent SMS when I was on the bus and the car was ready and waiting. Nice option to park here even if you are not a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Tired airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxsar911
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance lobby was ok. After that there wasn't a lot very positive to say. The room was in bad shape. Everything looked as though the hotel has been used hard. Ok, it is an airport hotel, but I would still look somewhere else if you have a chance. The fitness center had decent machines, but they were all filled by 5:00am. I stayed there two long days. I won't stay there again. Please note that there was nothing all that hateful about the place. The service I did get was uninspired, but no one did a particularly bad job.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for $99/night”
Reviews.Author: cblaiz
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal around $99/ night plus tax and parking. Fine place for an airport hotel and convenient. It is a quick drive to Marina Del Rey and Venice. Nice staff, clean lobby, bar and restaurant and decent gym for a hotel. Would stay again at this price after AAA discount. They also have a AAA park and fly deal that is worth investigating.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Shalanda30
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Renaissance before in other states and this particular one was average. The rooms were clean, but small. The breakfast buffet is $33.00 per person, which is not worth it. The staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel- Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TrippingAmerican
Reviews.Content: I take my hat off to the great customer service you get at this Renaissance Hotel. The rooms, we had a suite, are very nicely sized, and up-scale. I am today give a big WOW to Joe Elgar, Bellman. He has a smile that lights up anyone's day. This curly haired guys bends over backward to make you not only feels welcome, but does all he can to show how special it is to stay at a Renaissance Hotel. We are Platinum Elite with Marriott and can strongly recommend this as a kick off or wind-down from a long trip. Thanks Joe. Rube

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - great staff -excellent meal”
Reviews.Author: paddyboyfoley
Reviews.Content: This hotel makes travel easy - the staff are outstanding, the meal in the bistro was five star. Lounge and breakfast excellent. There was nothing I could say negative about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel option”
Reviews.Author: Blackjack4949
Reviews.Content: I was pressed to find a hotel near LAX for a one night stay. My coworkers colleagues usually stay at one of the two Embassy Suites location prior to an early am flight. I don't have any negative feedback about either of those options. I was however pleasantly surprised by the Renaissance. All the rooms were modern and must have been recently renovated. Dare i say i found some resemblance to the decor at W?...only in the interior of the rooms. The common areas were decent no negative feedback. This hotel offers room service w/ is not always what i find at the hotel airports. The neighborhood is well...an airport neighborhood. I found this to be a perfect hotel when you have a late night flight from the east coast. Also this hotel offered a shuttle w/ is great if you have to return your rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: Woodstock1968
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel and much improved over last year when I had plumbing problems in my room. (To be fair, the hotel gave me points for my troubles last year.) The rooms are nice and comfortable. Bath products are premium. The fitness room was very accomodating. I didn't eat at the hotel this time other than the breakfast bar/to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: K_K_travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance twice, at arrival and departure. Room and service was what should be expected from a 4* hotel, however it is a bit dated. We remember that the food in the restaurant was very good. We would stay here again, but not for more than a couple of days.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska
Reviews.Title: “GREAT rooms, mixed elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: kevin_from_AKandCO
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here when I was stranded at LAX overnight. Renaissance hotels can be all over the place in terms of design and quality but this one is very good overall. Hotel lobby is nice if a little dated, and the rooms were very nice. Phenomenally comfortable beds, and as most other reviewers have noted, the rooms are very well insulated from airport noise (and from other rooms). I slept great. The hallways are a bit tired and cheap looking - so the nice room was a pleasant surprise. Too tired to eat elsewhere, I had dinner in the bar. The meal was fine, but horrendously overpriced for what it was. Bartender showed little interest in me or the other 2 bar patrons. Breakfast in the restaurant was excellent (great selection, good quality) but very overpriced. $17 for a cold breakfast buffet? $23 for hot buffet? REALLY? I expect pricier food at a Renaissance but I thought this place was over the top for the quality. The concierge I worked with to coordinate getting to Orange County was excellent. She was friendly, knowledgeable, and very efficient. I was most delighted with check-in and check-out. I'm a Marriott Rewards member, and used to quick service, but my check-in was completed in less than 30 seconds (but still very friendly). I'd stay here again for the rooms alone, and the (mostly) excellent service was a great bonus. If the food was a better value I would have been delighted.

Reviews.Title: “The position is the positive”
Reviews.Author: Snorlaxxl
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Hotel 4 years ago and it was the logical choice for us to spend the night near the airport. The position is first class - our sons love being able to see planes on their approaches. Also the airport shuttles that run every 15-20 mins are excellent. What we did notice this time was that the rooms seemed a little tired with wear and tear. We had two adjoining rooms that were adequate and I guess for just over $100 a night you get what you pay for. The prices in the breakfast and bar areas are expensive. Front desk staff were efficient without being over friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastTravels034
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here multiple times and will continue to stay at this hotel. The hotel has its own parking garage which you can self park and its easy to get in and out ($16). The front desk has been helpful. They have multiple computers in which you can print your boarding pass. A nice workout/exercise room. The rooms themselves are large with multiple TVs, wonderful Aveda bath products, and additional seating areas. For being close to the airports I do recommend leaving the fan running to void the airport traffic noise. The room service is fast and efficient. I love the french onion soup and steak sandwich. The hotel is of good value at under $125. I will continue to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: Mooneydriver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in the last couple of years. As the "funky" and "quirky" brand of Marriott, the Renaissance experience varies from hotel to hotel (most, if not all, Renaissance hotels are acquired from other chains and as such there's no design consistency among Renaissance hotels). This particular hotel is an elegantly-appointed hotel with professional staff and great housekeeping. Both public spaces and rooms are sparkling clean. Despite the proximity to LAX, the rooms are adequately soundproofed. Rooms are well-furnished and comfortable. Bathrooms are larger than typical Marriott bathrooms. Parking is reasonable at $14/night. The Concierge Lounge is ample and well-stocked with breakfast items in the morning and snacks/drinks in the evening. All in all, I recommend it to anyone who has to spend a night near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Property Near LAX”
Reviews.Author: Davidwatts
Reviews.Content: Location is the key criterion for an airport hotel; this one gets high marks as it is less than 10 minutes to the terminals. As a bonus, it is within a couple of blocks of the Hertz, Avis and Budget facilities (car rental facilities are not consolidated at LAX and are not on airport property). The best part is that there is no sacrifice in quality to obtain the location. The rooms are adequately sized, clean and nicely furnished, although not necessarily with the most modern dÃ©cor. My room included a refrigerator; this was not advertised, so may not be a standard feature. I didnâ€™t notice any airplane noise. The staff are all very pleasant. A shuttle to the terminals runs every 15-20 minutes, 24 hours a day. Has a large, well equipped fitness center, open 24 hours. There is a staffed business center, open during the day (I didnâ€™t use this); in addition there several computers for internet access (for a small fee) near the gift shop which are available 24 hours. I ate dinner in the restaurant. The food was surprisingly good, although a bit overpriced as expected for a hotel restaurant. Service was good. Not many choices nearby, other than several other hotel restaurants and a Burger King across the street. BOTTOM LINE: GREAT choice near LAX; hard to imagine nearby properties being superior.

Reviews.Title: “Park, Sleep, Fly”
Reviews.Author: zoecatCA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for their free 7 day parking. We had a 7AM flight so we decided to explore LA and then stay at a hotel instead of dealing with traffic from Orange County to LAX. You need to book the sleep and fly package to do this. You self park in their secure underground parking garage. You can park for seven days which is included in your room rate and take the free shuttle to the airport for your flight. When you get back from your trip, bring your receipt of your stay at the hotel (or they can look it up for you) to the Concierge and they will give you ticket to get out of the garage. The hotel is a full service hotel with very nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Greystone26508
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here as a stopover after our overseas trip. The hotel is very close to the airport and has a complimentary shuttle. This is a very attractive hotel and includes a valet, concierge, etc. The rooms are modern and the beds are VERY comfy. There is a also a hot tub and pool with comfy chairs and chaise lounges. I didn't use the fitness room but it had way more than the usual hotel, including free weights. My hotel package included a breakfast buffet. The buffet was delicious and included fresh fruit, pastries, real bacon and omelets/eggs cooked to order. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SAMOKHAKIDOJR
Reviews.Content: Very nice and great breakfast buffet, will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Convienient comfortable spacious and reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: private1_90732
Reviews.Content: Booked via Marriott website using rewards points e-certificate. Used free airport shuttle but it seems to be a 20-30 minute circuit wait. Check in was efficient and information was correct. They provided a free upgrade to a suite. Suite was roomy, well equipped, clean and functioning but layout could be made slightly more efficient. Although table lamp on writing desk has readily accessible charging points, its near the door to the room in a separate area well away from the bed. I believe it is more efficient to have the lights near bed also have multiple charging plugs so phones and tablets can be charged and within ready reach when urgent calls come through and also allow phone wake up alarms well within hearing range (I dislike having to move beds and tables to access power plugs) I also used hotel wake up service and it was prompt. Room service was a normal 20 minute wait, food was good quality and a fairly large portion. Check out was quick, accurate and efficient. Free Hotel shuttle back to airport was much appreciated. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place if staying near LAX”
Reviews.Author: bondj303
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides free shuttle service for airport pickup and drop off. The shuttle runs approximately every 30 mins and I was lucky that I got it both times relatively quickly without having to wait much. The hotel decor is nice and the room was spacious and clean. In spite of being close to the airport, the room was quiet and I did get a restful sleep. I didn't need to use the room service so cannot comment on it, but the check in and check out was relatively smooth for me. They didn't have my Marriott Rewards No on the reservation and they couldn't pull it up by my name (which is a bit weird, as I had to provide it via my email as somehow I had issues logging into my account at Marriott.com at that time from my smartphone to retrieve the info). Apparently the parking is pricey. I wanted to rate it above average (3 circles) but below very good (4 circles), but the don't have a rating of 3.5 (which given the way it is ranked would be just "good").

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: Nice room with comfy beds. Shuttle collected and dropped us at the airport only a few minutes away. The service was friendly. Dinner at the bar was good value. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for an easy stopover hotel at the airport. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: bill925
Reviews.Content: Just spent a night at the Renaissance Los Angeles International Airport. From the beginning it started out poorly. While checking in at the front desk. As a Platinum Elite Member Iâ€™m used to having an accessible Concierge Lounge with complimentary bottled water and soft drinks. Since this was a Friday evening, I knew there would be no service in the Lounge for the weekend so I asked the young lady at the front desk about breakfast since the lounge wouldnâ€™t be serving on Saturday. When I stay on weekends I usually get my breakfast comped. This property comps nothing. To make matters worse, the young lady stated the Concierge Lounge is for Platinum Members only. I guess since I was wearing a sweatshirt and jeans instead of my usual suit, she assumed I was a nobody. I reminded her I was a Platinum Elite Member and she stated, Oh! I told her I wanted a room that wasnâ€™t connected as I always do because of the noise from the rooms next door. She stated she would give me a corner room (and that usually means a larger room). I got to the room and the first thing I noticed is that it was a connecting room which I told her I didnâ€™t want. As a corner room, this was the smallest room Iâ€™ve seen. I called and got a different room which was much bigger. The bed was very hard, not like the comfortable Marriott bedding I find at other properties. The wireless internet was not working, nor was the DSL connection. I called the front desk again, and they transferred me to the help desk. I waited and waited on hold, but gave up after five minutes. The next task was to find dinner. I asked a lady working the Concierge desk if there were any restaurants that delivered. She gave me a few menus from local places and told me I must be in my room when they arrive if I order out. Once again, my intelligence was insulted by a young lady who must have thought I was a country bumpkin. I explained to her I do this on a regular basis and walked away. How rude these employees were! I stopped by the Concierge Lounge to at least get some bottled water, but everything was put away so nobody could get anything. I ran into another gentleman in the lounge also looking for water, and he too agreed this was unreal, and the personnel were unfriendly. So after a long day of flying I decided to take a shower. At least that worked well. After drying off, I put the robe on that was hanging in the closet, and couldnâ€™t help but laugh. This was the smallest, tightest, cheesiest robe Iâ€™ve ever seen. It felt almost like spandex it was so tight. I then decided to order out after seeing the room service menu and found the best Italian food. This was the only high point at this Renaissance. The Restaurant was Valentinoâ€™s Pizza and I figured it would be good since they guy I spoke with on the phone was Italian. Their food exceeded my expectations, and the prices were very reasonable. Iâ€™ll write a review on them later. Getting back to the Renaissance. Will I stay here again? Never! Will I recommend it to anyone? Never! I think I would stay at a Fairfield Inn over this place. At least the Fairfield Inns have friendly employees. At the best, this is a three star property. The General Manager here certainly doesnâ€™t promote customer service. I stay at Marriott properties all over the U.S. because Marriott has the best customer service that Iâ€™ve come to expect. so if you are looking for a hotel near Los Angeles International Airport, donâ€™t stay here. There are a lot of other hotels by the airport that Iâ€™ll bet have much better service. So for all my fellow business travelers, Iâ€™m sure there is a Marriott nearby that will meet the business travelers expectations. This isnâ€™t the place!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Bryandmiller1
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, stayed here many times.....but during a recent stay I did experience sharing the bed with bed bugs!! Not a pleasant experience. Room 950 if you're keeping track. The hotels response was good, manager said they would close the room off for debugging, as well as surrounding rooms. They corporate folks also called to check up on me later. They have yet to reimburse me for the expense of debugging my clothes and bag. Still waiting...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent LAX location. Excellent facility and Service.”
Reviews.Author: Triaero
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I am a fan of Marriott properties and have stayed at the Marriott LAX for years. I won't be going back there after "discovering" the Renaissance. I've stayed here both for business and for a "get away" weekend to SoCal.Great facility and staff. Easy access compared to the hassles of the Marriott. Very good weekend rates. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite LAX Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, recently updated. The staff is the best, I've been to this location many times and they all remember my name which makes me feel at home. The beds are very comfortable and everything in the room is very clean and I've never heard noise from other rooms or the outside world. The lounge on the 11th floor is very nice, comfortable size room that serves breakfast and evening snacks. The lounge staff is extremely friendly and will always stop by your table to say hello and thank you for staying. My only complaint about this hotel is the drink prices in the bar are way too high. $7.50 for a beer is crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep in a very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thisiskeng
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in August 2011 for business in Los Angles area Pros - Close to airport, but still very quiet - Nice lobby - Groovy elevator and its ambient music - Burger King across the street for quick bite late at night / Budget Rental Car is nearby - Helpful staffs - Comfortable room and bed - Got the package including parking and Wifi, which is valuable - Frequent shuttle service from the airport Cons - Very empty neighbourhood. Feel dangerous walking out at night - Very basic bathroom - Slow elevator - Parking (without package) is very expensive - Could always hear the door slam from next room, which woke me up sometime at night

Reviews.Title: “Big, impersonal & boring.”
Reviews.Author: Kansei
Reviews.Content: Nope, I did not have the time of my life here. But I do not like places without personality. But I can recommend the lamb burger in the lobby restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Close”
Reviews.Author: sactokaren
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you need easy access to the airport. The convenient shuttle to and from the airport was a blessing. The bed was comfortable and the room was fairly dark and quiet. My only complaint is regarding the Wi-Fi charge. They charge $12.50 for use from 2 PM to 2 PM. Unfortunately, I logged in prior to 2 PM on our arrival day and was still logged in after 2 PM, so I was charged twice for the Wi-Fi service. I think the charge is excessive for even one 24 hour period, but to be charged doubled is just ridiculous for less than 2 hours of use. Did I complain to the management? No, our early morning flight didn't allow for me to spend the time disputing the additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for coming and going from LAX.”
Reviews.Author: shogun025
Reviews.Content: We have been here a few times over the past few years and love it. Convenient for arriving and departing for Cruises with free shuttle to and from the airport. Rates reasonable for the quality. Lobby has free WiFi which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Richard Y
Reviews.Content: Saty here all the time. Has some challenges with hot water and Internet. Destination restaurant. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good property overall, but hard to get work done”
Reviews.Author: abgwin
Reviews.Content: A quick trip to LA for a meeting meant choosing between the LAX Marriott and Renaissance. Based on a great stay at the Newark Renaissance, I chose the Montura. Maybe it suffered in comparison, but I wasn't terribly impressed. The staff was very good, especially the wait staff in the restaurant (some of the best service I've had in recent memory). The hotel itself seems to showing its age. The furnishings are nice but worn in places. The linens are good quality, but they skimp on how many you get. The mattress in my room needed to be flipped or replaced, and the desk chair wasn't an office chair - it looked like a dining room chair repurposed to the desk. It was so worn out I couldn't sit at the desk and get any work done. The same was true in my colleague's room. The shower was very very nice - especially for a Southern California hotel. Big shower head, lots of water flow and high enough for taller people to use in comfort. I doubt people visiting LA would stay in the LAX area - it's not a good tourist part of LA - so most people would be using this hotel for a night layover, and it's perfect for that, especially for pleasure trips. If you need to get work done that doesn't require a cocktail, maybe this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “LA”
Reviews.Author: Harytaj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance hotel during a recent trip to LA. The room and bath were quite satisfactory and the hotel staff were generally friendly. Although it shouldn't be surprising, nothing was complimentary - covered parking, internet, and breakfast. The only thing that wasn't extra was the use of a coffeemaker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location to lax”
Reviews.Author: jxe47
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy check in after a long flight. Beautiful room with comfortable bed. I flew in from the East Coast to visit my daughter and arrived very late and wanted to just get to bed instead of traveling to her home so late. I took the shuttle which was very easy to the hotel, front desk was quick to check me in and up to my room. It was clean and cozy room. My husband and I stayed there quite a few years ago and were pleased that stay and I was equally as pleased this time.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: NoDumbPeople
Reviews.Content: FIrst off, the staff at this Renaissance were excellent. This review is not a reflection of them. My main gripe is the BEDS were horrible. I changed rooms twice and both times the beds were slanted at a downward angle so the blood rushes to your head. Could not sleep at all. I was about ready to sue these guys. I can get a better night's sleep at a Super 8. Why would a 4-star hotel have cheap beds? Anyone?

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: JeannieStu
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel close to the airport with a shuttle for an overnight layover. Researched all airport hotels and found this one to have the most positive reviews for what I needed. Clean comfy bed and good breakfast. It had all of these. After a long trip in Asia with no hot water and sometimes no heat in the room, it was a luxury to have all of the above. Shuttle was prompt and was only shared with one other hotel. The rooms were big with modern amenities Aveda bath products, clean towels and sheets, however the fitted sheets are very loose and I needed to keep pulling tighter. (this would be my only negative) The buffet breakfast was plentiful with omelet station, bagels with toaster, pancakes, fresh smoothies. They had everything. Free wifi in the lobby was a nice touch too. Overall for an airport hotel it really exceeded my expectations. I was not expecting much at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice--people, location, rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Adventure
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Montura is a convenient and comfortable stay near LAX or west side business. Head north for easy access to the 405 and head South or East to the 405 or the 105 to get to your destination east. The property is clean, pleasant and management is visible. Affable Carlo, manager and executive on duty was attentive, courteous and pleasant. The staff checks you in quickly and gets you to your room with ease. The rooms are clean and well appointed--I had a long walk from the elevator--but I quickly got over it when I fell into bed.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: cee s
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 10/08/11 for one night. In the morning, woke up w small round bumps on my legs next to each other. Didn't think much of it until I got back home. Upon checking out my suitcase, I found several bedbugs! I've contacted the hotel and have not heard back. Strongly urge staying away from this place and/or, if you must, thoroughly check your room!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel....Would Not Recommend It.”
Reviews.Author: RondaJS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance with my husband for one night in September 2011. The hotel is nothing special. The rooms are quite old. The beds were really nice though. The airconditioning in the room was very oud. The hotel provides Aveeda products in the bathroom which I really enjoyed. Overall, our stay was fine; there weren't any major problems. However, I thought the hotel fell short of what I expect from Renaissance Hotels. This hotel is a standard airport property with pretty bland style. The service was fine. The room was OK -- comfortable bed; the rest of the decor was average and seemed a little worn. I wouldn't recommend it..much better hotels in LA. Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple

Reviews.Title: “Excellent chef concierge, but need improvements in some areas”
Reviews.Author: OregonTraveler9999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is also called Renaissance Los Angeles Airport Hotel. The hotel is very close to LAX, with free shuttle airport < > hotel service. Ms. Kathy, chef concierge was very helpful, professional and provided excellent service. The only complaint that I have of this hotel is they were upgrading their TV service, so the tv would switch to the welcome channel all by itself, no matter what channel you're watching at the time. While I understand that you "got to do what you got to do", but it's still very annoying. However, they did compensate me for the inconvenience. Another thing that might be worth noting is the hotel doesn't provide lunch room service. But during my stay, there was a conference going on, and they did provide lunch room service, but only for the week. The room service department stated that it would take about 30 minutes for the food to arrive, but it took maybe at most 10 minutes for my food to arrive, twice in a row. And the food was delicious! Nevertheless, it would be nice if they also provide lunch room service.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: fraugast
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for, a decent 4* hotel near a busy airport. However, the airport was only visible (from our room we could see a runway with planes landing, quite fascinating) not audible, noise was not an issue. The lobby is quite impressive, the rooms are just average and show signs of wear. But they are decently sized and the size of the bathroom is also ok. Everything was clean. Since we were travelling with kids we made extensive use of the pool area. The pool is small, but there was a sufficient amount of sunbeds. What was not available in sufficient quantity were towels. The pool area was definitely a neglected area of this hotel. Nobody bothered to collect used towels and nobody bothered to supply fresh towels. One evening we had to call the reception and then go to the reception TWICE to get towels for our kids (and 14 other people) in the pool. The good thing about the pool was that it is open till 23:00 p.m, thus even after a late arrival or a day full of sightseeing we could make use of the pool. We were not happy with the children's policy at the gym. Our 12 year old son is an avid runner and works out every day. He was not allowed to use the treadmill. He definitely was not playing on the machine but seriously working out and he was supervised, as I was next to him, but we were told that he was not allowed the treadmill and he had to get off. Very difficult to understand. We were very impressed by the breakfast buffet that was included in the price. There was really everything from scrambled eggs to salmon to a wide selection of pastries. Everything was very fresh and of good quality. A nice touch was the cookie decorating activity that was offered for the children on Saturday afternoon. Our children really enjoyed this. WIFI is charged for in the rooms, however there is free WIFI in the lobby, there are even special computer tables with power outlets. Also available are computers and printers for guest use. Parking in the hotel parking garage is 25$ per day, however there is ample free parking in the streets behind the hotel, we never had to walk more than maybe 200 yards. Overall a pleasant hotel experience, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “used to be great, now less than good”
Reviews.Author: Isabel S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times over the years. I used to look forward to an early morning flight from LA so I could stay there. No longer. The management does not seem to be taking care of the property. The "E" in the name of their hotel on the top of the building is not working. It looks like the "HOT L BALTIMORE". . The windows used to open a little. No longer. My room had a burnt out light bulb. It smelled of foot odor from a previous guest. (And you can't open the window.) And when I asked, "When do the shuttles leave for the airport?" (the whole point of staying there) I was told that there was no schedule but the shuttles left ever 20 or 25 minutes or so. So this meant I needed to be ready 25-30 minutes before I would otherwise have had to. So, I needed to get up at 5:00 and now had to make it 4:30 because there was no schedule. And then the bus did not go directly to the airport, instead it stopped at another hotel first. They did not tell me this. And why didn't I stay at the other hotel? So the place has gone down but the prices have not. Housekeeping is SO important for a hotel. You trust the hotel to be clean enough not to pick up a fungus from the floor or have bugs to ride home in your luggage. I was very disappointed. This used to be great but shoddy management has killed it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: gotozmoon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I actually got this hotel through Priceline, but we couldn't be happier. The front desk accommodated our requests and put us in a room facing the airport...I love watching planes land. Soundproof windows worked perfectly. We found street parking around the hotel, so we did not have to pay $25/night. Very clean, spacious. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: MEaton
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed and the hotel exceeded my expectations. Staff at front door set the tone. They were extremely friendly as was the front dest clerk. Room was very impressive. I will make this a regular stop when in LA

Reviews.Title: “Decadance and delights! :)”
Reviews.Author: natzba
Reviews.Content: We are two Kiwis who stayed there on the start of our honeymoon. We decided to stay at an airport motel as they are way cheaper than santa monica and hollywood. We chose the renaissance as my sis and BIL stayed there too and raved about it. The place is real luxury The rooms are huge and staff professional. It was great to find a 'gift shop' in the place which sold everything you need - which was helpful when I got a chest infection soon after we arrived. We got a bus nearby to santa monica which took about an hour to get to (remember this is on a bus). We hired a car for two days from budget which is just across the road. Sooo glad we did this as the best way to see LA really is a car (sad but true). The pool and gym area were great too. Couldnt fault. We had the best breakfast of my LIFE in the restaurant downstairs. I kid you not it was fantastic!!!! There was a hotel next door we were able to do our washing at for a small fee. Hubby left me at the gym and went and did it. A few hours later he came back a bit intoxicated having had a few beers while waiting for it to finish. So funny! Didnt hear the planes nearby whatsoever. Parking isnt free (or cheap) so we parked just outside for free. They have a free shuttle to the airport too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hdbishopjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. The service was great and the room was very comfortable. The concierge was very helpful helping us fill our afternoon with things to do. The concierge sent up a free bottle or wine with a fruit plate when we returned from one of our activities as a thank you for staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service at a Top Notch Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFam39
Reviews.Content: This hotel did a perfect job taking care of me as their customer! Clean, nice and a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Geat airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Road_adventures
Reviews.Content: We were returning from New Zealand and had booked this hotel to spend two nights in Los Angeles to break-up the trip before returning home. We arrived at the hotel in Los Angeles from New Zealand at 8:30 am. When we went to the front desk expecting to store our luggage until the 3 pm check-in, but were pleasantly surprised. The person at the front desk asked if we would like our room now. Being exhausted from the all night flight we told him that would be great. The next day I went to the front desk to get infomation on how to get to downtown LA and Hollywood. They were very helpful and recommended the free LA shuttle bus to the metro and to purchase an all day metro pass. We had a great time. The rooms and the staff at this hotel were excellent. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an airport location...”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night since we had a 7 a.m. flight out of LAX the next morning. Check-in process was easy and they were helpful. Not a bad location to return a rental car (wasn't walking distance for us, though)...Shuttle was on-time...room was average, but clean. They did have a flat screen tv which was a nice touch for an aiport hotel...would stay again if needed to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “good enough”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to the aiport and to the car rental services providers. We booked online and got free parking at the hotel, which was surprisingly pricey. Check in was smooth and we stayed there very briefly. The bathrooms could have been nicer but overall it was fine for what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport, Nice Rooms, Overall Pleasant 3.5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: pullthetab
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night between flights to/from LAX. Pros: Room was standard, clean, recently updated. Concierge people were unbelievably nice and efficient. Restaurant was decent. Cons: 1.Airport shuttle, which is a combined shuttle with other hotels (as most are), was crazy. We waited more than 30 minutes at the airport for the shuttle. When we wanted to go back the next day, told there are no real times, it's hit and miss, average wait close to 30 minutes. So we found alternate transportation. 2. Pay for internet (as noted by others) in this day and age is ridiculous. How would it be if hotels charged $25 a day to watch TV, or said, if you want to watch it for free, go to the lobby. Marriott, and other chains, need to move with the times - how many people travel with their tablets! 3. Check in took about 20 minutes. Arrived at 11pm, only 1 person at the counter, and there were 7 of us arriving on the shuttle, and already 2 in line. Should have capability for more staff. Other than those 3 items, decent place and people.

Reviews.Title: “One nite only but enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: rtwtraveller10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance fAt LAX for one night only it was just for a few hours but enough to appreciate, airport shuttle on skedule, room very clean, kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great access to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Osdanuwati
Reviews.Content: Parking is $25/night or $32 for valet. There are cheaper options nearby if you don't mind a couple of minutes walk. Good for a night's stay before or after a flight in/out of LAX. My room was $101/night which was better than most area options. The rooms are pretty room, a bit dated in appearance but perfectly service-able. Finding it and getting in and out take a bit of getting used to as it is not ON Century Blvd, like most other chains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, decent Hotel, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Pranky79
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 friends from work who were looking at a hotel around LAX airport area and can accomodate in 2 rooms. This was the perfect place as the hotel rooms are pretty spacious and the hotel is well located with regular bus services from airport which is complimentary. The hotel also arranged a day trip to San Diego for us right from the door step. Budget Car rental and Burger King is bang opposite the hotel which are good options to have for a traveller.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: aussie_travel_mum_
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Monture LA on our way home to Australia from New York. At the time of booking the hotel was offering a 25% discounted rate which made the price much more reasonable. From the outset, I can admit that we would not pay the full rate for what we got - simply overpriced in our opinion, especially with parking and internet being being additional charges. Our check in was not as smooth as planned as we waited curb side at LAX for over half an hour before the complimentary shuttle appeared. The wait included two phone calls to reception to try and track down the transport! The issue is not the fault of the hotel due to the badly designed LAX collection bays - but the hotel should pay more attention to the whereabouts of their shuttles as there was another bus directly behind our shuttle making a mockery of their claim that one they are set at 15 min intervals. Maybe one bus skipping some stops and going ahead to passengers at other terminals is advised? The hotel itself was very quiet and clean. The beds were a bit soft for our liking but that is simply personal preference. We all slept well so that is the important thing! Breakfast is overpriced so we opted for a simple meal at the Burger King across the road. We did pay the additional fee for internet nor did we have time to fully explore the hotel. Instead we took a taxi downtown for approx $30 - convenient as there is a taxi bay at the front of the hotel. For the afternoon, we purchased Manhattan Beach trolley tickets from the hotel for which the closest stop was only a short walk away. It was a nice way to spend the afternoon - but beware that this is not a quick journey so you shouldn't plan this outing on a tight schedule. Returning home was much longer than getting there and took 45 mins... Overall the stay was pleasant, but if paying full price we we could've got very similar accommodations for cheaper in the LAX precinct.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience except for one important thing....”
Reviews.Author: Loves2TravelALOT_11
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Renaissance hotel and noticed immediately that it was where the flight crews stay. I was the only non- pilot on the free shuttle bus. The staff at check in was great. She noted I was a Marriott Gold member and thanked me for my business. She worked hard to find a room on the concierge level but apologetically said' would you be ok if I put you in a suite on a lower floor since I can't find anything better'? Nice way to start. The room was fine BUT i noticed no shampoo was in the room. WHen i called to get some sent up, the same gal from check in apologized profusely and had someone bring some up. When i called later for room service the first question she asked was if i got the shampoo. Great front desk follow through. When i went to shower this morning, i noticed hair in the shower. Not one or two but several. Rather gross. Given this and the issue with the lack of shampoo i'd suggest their housekeeping manager double check their work. Other than that, the room was nicely appointed, quiet and quite comfortable. The front desk staff went out of their way to please. I did notice the breakfast in the concierge lounge seemed much better than many other Marriott lounges so this was a nice surprise. This is very close to LAX and off the main drag of Century Blvd so quieter than most.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - noisy aircondition”
Reviews.Author: SteRos
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, OK rooms, clean, nice bath room, but very noisy aircondition. Good service and very good breakfast. OK for "on night stay" when arriving LAX. We arrived very late and left again early in the morning. I only rate in "average" due to very noisy aircondition.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hogandoc
Reviews.Content: Hard to access, turn from 1 way street; hidden $25/day parking fee automatically added. Pretty lobby; good access to LAX. Burger king across street(6 lane blvd). Lots of walking, staff seemed undertrained, no free food ammenities, pay for everything. Very, very expensive, room fairly basic.I really expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Charged TWICE!”
Reviews.Author: KatLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We were charged TWICE for both our breakfast and our stay at the hotel! The receptionists declined to call their manager to resolve this issue. When asked when the money would be (hopefully) returned on the card, they said that maybe several days. For foreign visitors with planned budget for their cards this is completely unacceptable - especially when it happens twice at the same hotel! Obviously more than just a negligence. I will try to find a different airport hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough fr a night”
Reviews.Author: World-Traveller-one
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a long overseas trip - priced very competitively and our room comfortably accommodated a family of four. Breakfast was better than expected. Will quite adequately satisfy expectations if staying a night or two before connecting through LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Great managment...best lax hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kimmer
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at most of the LAX area hotels, I would advise that the Renaissance Montura is the best of the group. We now stay there exclusively becuase it is so well managed. All of the employees go out of their way to provide whatever assitance is needed and do so with a genuine sense of hospitality. On a recent trip, a small snafu was immediately addressed and corrected by manager Patrice Desvarieux who really went beyond what was required in making sure we were satisfied. The breakfast buffet is outstanding and actually much superior to the Ritz Carlton's in nearby Marina del Rey where we also stayed on this trip. In fact, on this particular visit the staff and service were also suprerior at the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Hibba
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean, the staff was very helpful and nice. Others wrote that you can hear airplanes since its soo close to the airport, but i didnt notice at all. My husband and i were at the hotel only at night to sleep and we didnt have a problem. You can find parking on the street instead of paying $25 a night. Check right in front of Burger King. I also like staying near the airport cuz its soo close to everything not like other airports, LAX is right in the middle. You can easily go to the northern beaches like Santa Monica (my favorite!), Venice, Malibu, Marina Del Rey. and then its only a 10 min drive to Manhattan Beach and Redondo beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice entrance, horrible room”
Reviews.Author: xraveller
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Marriott hotel had elegant entrance hall mildly pricy room. I was not expecting the area to be fantastic, so when I saw that it was in broken area, it was okay, but the room I stayed at smelled so bad. The entire room smelled like rotten feet, and the bed smelled like sperms. It was so unpleasant, I wanted to leave. Staff was so unorganized, uneducated, and untrained. They miss spelled my name when I checked in, so I could not have access to the internet. It was terrible service, horrible place and not a happy price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend a night while traveling”
Reviews.Author: Maggie G
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Renaissance around midnight and were greeted by cheerful personnel at the valet station and inside the hotel. Because we would be leaving early in the morning, our car was allowed to be parked at the hotel entrance overnight and we were only charged the self-park price. Also, the attendant at the desk very quickly assisted us in getting some extra coffee for the morning. The rooms were clean and met our expectations. Although we did not get to test out many of the amenities, this was a nice hotel convenient to the airport. My only suggestion would be to keep the bar open later, we had to go next door for a late night drink.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: sbcutie01
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, excellent location, pleasant stay! Needed a quiet hotel for the night and was welcomed by an accommodating staff. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Class, Quality, Location Convenience”
Reviews.Author: SherryK69
Reviews.Content: Standard, well appointed hotel with exceptional staff. Asked for and received quiet room. Clean, comfortable beds. Quiet, even though under LAX runway! Parking and internet not free. No nice restaurants nearby, but easy to get everywhere from here, so a good base. Charged in the business center to print out boarding pass. Would have given 5 stars, but the location lacks ambience even though it is highly convenient to the airport, there is not much right there in terms of restaurants, you have to drive somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fine apart the super charge for the internet !”
Reviews.Author: Kardvader
Reviews.Content: As a foreigner I need Internet connections for my laptop and smartphone... This hotel is fine for everything apart from something which is key to me : Internet Connection. I happen to share my life (and my room) with my wife who also has a smart phone and a computer. In this hotel, in order to get 2 laptops and 2 smartphones connected, you need to pay an extra $52 (4 * $12,99) per day. This is outrageous and do not make sense. Paying once per day is barely acceptable but 4 times is a robbery. The Hotel Manager should seriously consider this type of issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, stay here”
Reviews.Author: hatchy9
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 3 nights at this hotel and I will stay here everytime while in LA. I had no rental car but the Lax transit center is just a short walk away so I was able to catch a bus every where I wanted to go. It's nice and close to all the beaches and offers a free shuttle to and from the airport. The staff were friendly, the room was very nice and if you needed to rent a car, they are all in walking distance of the hotel. Not much to do in the area but only a short cab ride to get anything you want.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yazhismith
Reviews.Content: Priceline Name Your Own Price deal so was quite happy. Have stayed in other Renaissance hotels in Las Vegas and Philadelphia so the brand is usually reliable for being comfortable and modern. Not happy with having to pay extra for in-room internet but the other services we used were good - in-room dining was really yummy and we got to hang out in the lounge waiting for our flight for a few hours. Oh and the internet kiosks could use with an update... they're really cruddy Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theresehols
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at start of tour. Free shuttle bus from airport. Rooms large and beds really comfortable. Bathroom well stocked. Best breakfast ever. Carrot juice shots and freshly made omlettes. Free wi fi in lobby a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: RetroFan
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here the night before we caught an early flight. The hotel is beautifully decorated and feels welcoming and the front desk staff was efficient and friendly. My main interest was having a safe place to park the car while we were gone and getting to the airport on time. We used the park and fly option and left the car in a secure covered parking structure. The shuttle bus came in a timely fashion in both directions. We didn't use any of the other services the hotel offers, but for what I wanted, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful and friendly staff in a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: beckyfever
Reviews.Content: This was not my first stay in a Renaissance hotel, and we usually stay in a three or four star when we travel, however, this is the first time I have felt strongly inclined to leave a positive review. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were pleasantly greeted by the valets and directed to the front desk where our reservation was quickly found by a smiling young lady. Everything about our stay was welcoming and convenient, from the quiet elevators, plush furnishings, updated technology, and consistently friendly staff. The thing that stood out the most to me was the good nature of everyone we encountered. The valets were especially nice, as was our waiter in the hotel restaraunt and the woman working in the gift shop. Some may find the aircraft noise to be distracting, however considering the proximity to the airport, I doubt that the rooms could be made much quieter. As a matter of fact, the air-conditioning made louder noise than the incoming aircraft and is probably my only complaint about the room. Also, one time that housekeeping cleaned our room, our empty fast food milkshake cups were not removed and our lovely water glasses that we had been using were replaced with paper coffee cups, even though we didn't once use the coffee machine. Those few quirks were very minor and all in all we had an excellent and enjoyable stay. We were never bothered by the housekeeping and the entire staff that we dealt with were very hospitable and thoughtful. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel all the way around....”
Reviews.Author: Ilovelamp27
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here. This time, it was a layover to our honeymoon.....great service, gorgeous room....I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking hotel, good service, perfect for early fight out of LAX”
Reviews.Author: SGO007
Reviews.Content: My friends and I was here for 1 night (12 people) and 4 rooms. The hotel was very clean and the lobby was very elegant. We pick the hotel because for the location to LAX and car rental centres. We were able to return our rental cars and walk back to the hotel. The service was great, everything was ready when we arrived and was very accommodating to some of our last minute changes. The Good: -Free shuttle to LAX -Close to car rental centres (walking distance to most) -Elegant looking lobby -The rooms were clean but very standard The not so good: -Internet was over ten dollars in the rooms and the free internet in the lobby was not up to par -The parking is over priced Overall it is a great hotel to stay at if you are flying out of LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Maui4us
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very pretty-as you enter the lobby there is a table with lovely orchids floating in tall clear vases, the lights are dimmed and this makes for an immediate sense of calm. Check in was super fast, our room was ready, we got our keys and off we went. Room was as expected with everything in place and nice and clean. Beds were comfy and plenty of towels and pillows. Our room overlooked the pool which we didn't use but the hot tub and pool looked kind of small. The location of this hotel was great for easy access to the airport, Beverly Hills, Manhattan Beach and LMU all of which we visited during our short stay. The valet service was great-we were staying here one night on our way to the desert for a week and didn't want to unload everything-the valet area is secure. If I had another reason to go to LA-I would absolutely choose this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: axxechikka
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay here and it was a great experience. Getting to the hotel is easy as can be, with free shuttle buses to and from all terminals of the airport about every 15 minutes. The friendly desk staff were able to meet my request for an early check in, which was much appreciated since I desperately needed a comfortable place to crash. And it was extremely comfortable, despite the room being a little smaller than I anticipated (it's just that they look bigger on the hotel website, the standard room is still perfectly adequate for a solo traveler or couple). I had a nice hot bath in the clean bathroom and used the free Aveeno products, then relaxed on the super comfy bed and watched cable tv. The Renaissance has the convenient proximity to the airport but not the noise of one. Really, it's so well soundproofed and that you forget you're near an airport until you walk out and see planes practically on top of you. That combined with the amazing bed and nice heavy curtains that completely block out the light ensure a good nights sleep. There are a couple of little downsides. The wireless internet is expensive ($12.95 a day) and if you want take out it's around a 15 minute walk to anything (Sepulvuda Blvd has lots of shops.) But if you can spare the money for a proper meal, the hotel restaurant the 96th St Bistro is excellent. Just order a main meal (they range in price from $18-40) and for free you get a small loaf of bread with 3 spreads (big enough to serve as a starter) and then afterwards they bring you this massive strawberry covered in chocolate and nuts that is amazing. So you get a free starter and free desert! The hotel is gorgeous too, with artwork in the lobby and nice looking decor. Recommended if you want a good mid priced hotel at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “The Best LAX-PERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: AmyLaurent
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short period while visiting LA. I wanted a hotel close to the airport, and everything else was sold out so I had little choice in the matter. Having said that, Iâ€™m so thankful things worked out that way! What a wonderful hotel! I had major problems with my flight and the front desk was amazing at finding out information for me, extending my stay and just being really accommodating. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and were actually quite spacious. One thing that bothered me (entirely superficial) was the fact that some of the colors clash in the room. Cream furniture mixed with rich wood didnâ€™t do much for me. Other than that you will have a great sleep on the beds, with a nice choice of pillows. In the bathroom there was a rubber duck, how cute is that? Nice quality shampoo/cream and plush towels. In the morning youâ€™ll look forward to a great breakfast buffetâ€¦â€¦probably the best Iâ€™ve ever had at an airport hotel. Shuttle to the airport is free, staff is friendly, property is clean and you wonâ€™t regret spending youâ€™re money there.

Reviews.Title: “No Regrets”
Reviews.Author: QXflyer
Reviews.Content: I have never been greeted by Hotel staff getting off the shuttle, and then greeted again in the Lobby and personally escorted to the Check-in desk! These people are going out of their way to make Customer Service a top priority. Room was clean, quiet and oh that Marriott bed ! I will never stay anywhere else during a LAX layover.

Reviews.Title: “The rudest front desk person ever.”
Reviews.Author: Analisa
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff (1 male individual) at this hotel is by far the rudest in all my years of travel I have ever had the unpleasure of dealing with. I was at check in March 20th at aprox 9pm. He needs to learn some people skills.

Reviews.Title: “Layover at LAX? Stay HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswell4fun
Reviews.Content: With a free and safe shuttle right from LAX to the front door of this beautiful, clean, safe, luxurious hotel there is simply nowhere else I would tell you to stay. It is the antithesis of anything you've heard about staying in a hotel around LAX. In fact, the surrounding hotels were acceptable looking properties as well. It is all a-okay. And it is literally across the street from the Budget Car Rental so no return trip to the airport to rent a car the next day. It is super safe to walk to the Budget Car Rental place from the hotel. It really was greatly convenient. I wish I had not done the buffet breakfast and simply ordered from the menu. The wait staff did become somewhat bothersome trying to always fill up my coffee or take away a plate. I wanted to be left alone to read the paper in peace but otherwise it was good. The rooms were as seen in my pics. You will do just fine staying here and should have no concerns about the shuttle, the facility, the area or anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for airport layovers”
Reviews.Author: Jetdriver11
Reviews.Content: Not much around the area....typical airport hotel, but nice and clean with good staff. Valet Parking

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: tnc2u
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to LAX with decent, clean rooms. We could hear the person in the next room, however. The hotel restaurant was very good. The hotel is a couple blocks from the Marriott LAX and across the street from a car rental place and Burger King. The front desk staff seemed a bit aloof, not the warmest staff, but we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, For The Right Price”
Reviews.Author: AccentdESIGN
Reviews.Content: If you need a nice & clean place to stay for a great price this is it! The reviews are all true: very friendly & helpful staff, clean facilities, very comfy bed! The only negative: Priceline said this was a 4 star+, I do not really believe that....It's great and nice but not super "fancy" if you get my drift. Also, parking is $27 per night HOWEVER plenty of free parking is available on the street directly behind the hotel. We parked for free both nights right outside the parking garage =) If you are looking for a quick stay or a central location for LA & Hollywood this is your place! You are 15 minutes from everything

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good service near LAX”
Reviews.Author: Fitch7600
Reviews.Content: I stay in the LAX area a lot and recently this has become my primary hotel. The rooms are pretty average sized but well furnished and comfortable. Nice bathrooms and high quality toiletries provided. The rooms all have mini-fridges, and a good flat screen TV's. I don't watch a ton of TV but it's easy to connect a laptop and watch a DVD with it. It's a particularly good value if your stay includes a Friday or Saturday night; that generally gets you a rate under $100 from Thursday through Monday. It is usually quite a bit higher mid-week. The trade-off is that for Marriott elites, there is a nice lounge that is open from Sunday night through Friday noon but closed on the weekends. Like most LAX hotels it uses the good shared shuttle service. Coming from LAX you have to stop at the Marriott first, but on the way to the airport it's non-stop.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Airport, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ferrywings
Reviews.Content: Flew to LA to position ourselves for an overseas flight. The Renaissance Montura was the perfect place for us to stay. Free shuttle from the airport, early check-in, free internet and helpful staff made a pleasant stay. We paid $20 more to upgrade to the concierge level and enjoyed a great breakfast buffet in the morning and heavy hors d'oeurves in the evening. Well worth the price. Our flight out wasn't until evening and we were able to stay in our room until mid afternoon. Beds were comfy, had a great bar downstairs. Only complaint is that the hot water was sporadic in the shower. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty.”
Reviews.Author: wadleyfla
Reviews.Content: From the time we walked in till we checked out, we were guven the red carpet treatment. Our plane had arrived very late and we were bushed. We asked for a quiet room. They changed our room in the computer to a very quiet room. With no exxageration, we heard no one else around us. Every staff member we met asked us if our room was okay. What excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: albiejnr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect stop for LAX airport. There is a free shuttle service to the hotel which takes a few minutes, the check in was extremely fast which is a bonus after a long flight. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The beds were very comfortable and we enjoyed a good nights sleep. It is well worth getting a breakfast inclusive rate because we paid about $20 extra on the room rate for breakfast and the cost is more than that if you pay separately. The breakfast was a huge array of everything you could want and well worth the money. We booked a car with Hertz which is an easy walk from the hotel. The hotel also stored our bags for the day while we went out which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Hype”
Reviews.Author: TheOtherLeft
Reviews.Content: I was slightly skeptical about the almost glowing reviews of the Renaissance, but, having spent the night, I can say perhaps what every airport hotel hopes to hear most: the Renaissance Montura feels like a "true" hotel, rather than a place to crash before an early flight the next day. The check-in staff was both very professional and friendly, with the sort of crisp attitude that often seems lacking at 9 p.m. among airport-hotel employees. The lobby and public rooms are stylish and appealing, and would not feel out of place downtown. The hotel perhaps aspires to be a little more chic than it can credibly pull off, given its location and purpose as airport lodging, but the bar seemed lively and people appeared to enjoy themselves in the sitting area near the entrance. My room was fully functional, on the smaller end for a four-star hotel but in keeping with other higher-end airport hotels at which I've stayed. The bathroom was fresh and relatively spacious, making up for the slightly utilitarian, though very clean, nature of the bedroom itself. Regrettably, Renaissance, like the rest of the Marriott chain, does charge an exorbitant rate -- roughly $15 a night -- for Internet access. A friend met me the next morning in his car, leaving it in the hotel's convenient garage. Realizing that we'd left the parking card in my room after check-out, I went back to the front desk, which immediately billed my credit card for two hours of parking without any questions and put the credit on my room key, so that I simply needed to swipe the key card at the garage exit and was on my way. A very intelligent and convenient system. It may be ambitious and its guest rooms may lack for excitement, but the Renaissance Montura is a respectable and comfortable hotel that has managed to define itself independent of LAX. I would strongly recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff//wonderful bargain”
Reviews.Author: ATLMISTRAL
Reviews.Content: I used TRIP ADVISOR for look for a hotel near LAX. This hotel fit my needs. Very quiet, even though we faced the airport and street. The staff was grand. Always smiling, courteous, and friendly. The room was clean, and quiet. Beds were good quality, and thread counts of the sheets fine. I would go back without a second thought. FYI--we were too tired wait for the free shuttle. LAX cabs charge a minimum $17.50 fare to take us 1 1/2 miles. I would advise to find the shuttle next time. My mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best Marriott branded LAX hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4959keeton
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel to be close to LAX for a morning flight. As a Marriott elite, they had originally upgraded me to the Concierge level. For some reason, they fouled up the room assignment so they relocated me to a lower floor, but it was a suite (sweet!). Great front desk staff. My room faced away from the airport and was dead quiet. The room was perfectly clean but you could tell it wasn't brand new. The TV was a flat screen with actual HD programming and the clock radio actually had decent sound quality. The wireless internet was OK for e-mail and web surfing, but was a litte slow for video streaming. The restaurant was very good, but pricey. The only other walkable dining options I found were the Burger King across the street or other area hotels. The Concierge lounge had above-average offerings for the evening hors d'oeuvres and morning breakfast. The airport shuttle is shared with the LAX Marriott so at peak times it can already be crowded when it picks up at the Renaissance. Parking is rather expensive ($25 self / $32 valet plus tax/tip) but there seemed to be plenty of on-street parking nearby. If you rent from Avis or Hertz, their lots are directly across the street so you can pick up (or drop off) your car by walking over and not have to deal with the hotel parking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: female_traveller_100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Renaissance (Mariott brand) adjacent to LAX for one night in order to catch an early flight out of LAX the next morning. Booked 2 double rooms (for myself and friends) at AAA club rate of $94 per room - a reasonable price. Although close to the airport, rooms are very quiet - did not even notice noise from other guests. The beds are impeccably clean and super-comfortable. Rooms were spacious and very clean, with large, clean bathrooms (granite counter) and a safe in-room (a security feature I appreciate). The elevators are fast-moving and numerous enough that we did not have to wait more than several seconds for our lift (although we checked-in late and left early). Requested a 5am wake-up call to catch an early morning flight, and the front desk called right at 5am on the button. This hotel advertises free 24hr shuttle to LAX. Front desk recommended arriving in the lobby 1/2 hr before the desired departure time from the hotel, however we did not have to wait more than about 5-10 minutes (at 6am) for the airport shuttle to arrive. Very quick and convenient. Only experienced one glitch: requested rooms on the same floor that were adjacent to each other, one with feather-free bedding. Initially was offered rooms on separate floors, but the check-in agent accommodated my request for rooms on the same floor (although they were not adjacent to each other - in fact they were situated at opposite ends of the hotel). As a result of this room-shuffling, I did not receive feather-free bedding - remedied the situation by taking an antihistamine to keep my allergies in check, so it turned out okay. Overall I was impressed with the property's convenient location, cleanliness and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Phenomenal Staff”
Reviews.Author: JFP
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renaissance LAX. I chose it for location, value and secured/guaranteed parking. The staff was friendly, courteous, welcoming and helpful from minute one. The staff at the front desk was phenomenal and accommodating. The room itself was good-sized. The bed was unbelievably comfortable, and there was no airport noise even though my window overlooked a busy runway. The only reason I couldn't give the room 5 stars was some carpet wear, paint dings and a lack of lighting, but really not a big deal. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy to/from LAX, good option for lay over”
Reviews.Author: Snert41
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on our way to French Polynesia, and then again for one night on our way back home. A nice stop over to split up very long flights. Hotel has courtesy shuttle to/from LAX which was easy to use. Both nights provided clean, decent sized rooms surprisingly without noise from the airport. We slept like babies on very comfortable beds. All the staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly and went out of their way to take care of us. Also had two great dinners in the hotel restaurant. We would definitely stay here again if we needed a lay over option.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a early morning or late arrival flight”
Reviews.Author: nldogbert
Reviews.Content: Location: Good for LAX. Shuttle is provided 24 hours with no fix schedule. It is a shared shuttle with the Marriott LAX and frequency is good. Reception: This hotel has the newer designed modern reception area. Check in was fast and staff friendly. Room: Typical Renaissance type room. Flat TV with good number of program selection. Bed was comfortable and windows sufficiently soundproofed from aircraft taking off. Bathroom: Well sized with typical amenities. In general, a good hotel and location. There is also a Concierge lounge which seems to be open even during the weekends with limited service. Only during the weekdays there are full lounge service. Though I did not try it, was glad to see that luckily not all lounges in the Marriott system are closed in the weekends. From my room, I had a view of the open air swimming pool and jacuzzi. Takes about 5 mins to reach the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great room”
Reviews.Author: joeboy1015
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't stay at this property due to the previous negative reviews. I'm currently in Room 706 and have no complaints whatsoever. The room is nice and clean, quiet from nearby LAX noise, and the staff has been very responsive. The hotel is a little old meaning its not brand new but it is in very good condition. The bed mattress, pillows, and linens are exceptional; the bathroom is spotless. The room has new flat panel TVs with good HD signal rather than just digital that I get in a lot of properties. The fitness center has individual television screens at every station so you can watch TV if you need the distraction. No good restaurants nearby but that's not why you stay at an airport property anyway. Burger King across the street, but the famous Inn-n-Out burger about an easy half-mile stroll away. Would definitely stay here again, especially if I can get the two-week advance purchase rate. Free wi-fi in lobby only, otherwise a stiff fee...as expected.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great”
Reviews.Author: muntechx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night as I had an early flight. Was a little nervous after reading some of the negative reviews but I shared none of their experiences. The hotel has a beautiful foyer, very nice restaurants and I found the staff helpful. The food in the restaurant, while a little pricey but was good eg Burger and fries and a beer cost me $20. The room was great, nice comfortable bed and i enjoyed watching the LCD TV. There were plenty of free channels to choose from on the TV. Bathroom was spotless. Caught the shuttle early to the airport in the morning with no dramas. Checked out with no problems over the phone as well. Will definitely stay again. Managed to get a deal for $94 per night with AAA card.

Reviews.Title: “I feel ripped off. Terrible experience. Should have stayed somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: JMYfromSF
Reviews.Content: Got a small room at the end of a dead end hallway. Would easily be trapped if fire broke out in hallway. Got room on Priceline as a 4-Star hotel. Priceline failed to mention that self park is $25/day and more if valet park. Failed to mention that pool and jacuzzi is drained for repairs so no pool use on 90 degree+ days. Priceline also failed to mention internet use is $12.95/day or $.50/min in lobby with $3 minimum charge. Less than 1/2 of channels is HD on TV. A good number of channels have poor signal so barely watchable. No in room TV schedule for HBO. Had Priceline not already billed me, I would have packed up and went to the Four Points Sheraton next door. I have received better amenities in 3 or 2 star Hotels. I have had better amenities and value at Courtyard Marriot properties. Marriot should be embarrassed to have their name associated with this hotel. It is extremely disappointing for a hotel of this caliber to nickel and dime their guests for every little thing. Even the business center computer had a credit card reader attached to the computers. How cheap can you be on a high-end 4-star hotel? For what guests are paying to stay here, you would think in room internet would be included as well as better satellite/cable subscription.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: l0vebug
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was an average hotel with an average stay. I'd recommend it for it's great, close location to the airport. Check your bill very carefully, however. I had two charges that weren't mine (a bar/restaurant charge and an extra internet charge). The staff was hesitant to remove the charges, but they did.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel, with free airport...”
Reviews.Author: Mezza76au
Reviews.Content: Good airport hotel, with free airport transfers and good clean rooms. We stayed here as a stop over on our way to NY and enjoyed the one night. Close to Manhatten beach which is very pretty. Small rattle in the air con was a downside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: Located right across the street from Budget Rental Car on Airport Drive at LAX airport.
