Pay the extra money to stay in a hotel adjacent to the theme parks, and save the long drive. Your kids will thank you. If you're traveling through LAX, if you're going to see LA area landmarks, I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Ozstitcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before our flight to Australia. It's only a couple of blocks from the airport and has a handy shuttle which they share with the Marriott. The shuttle is very clearly marked and runs every 15 mins or so. We had a room on the 2nd floor with 2 doubles. Considering I am a silver Marriott rewards member and my profile preference is high floor, I was not particularly happy. Our room had no view of the runways either..it faced the back of the hotel and the view was a roof. The room itself was lovely. The beds were awesome and the service great. The bellman who brought our bags up was very helpful when we discovered the fridge was not working. Turns out, it's not a fridge at all but a "chiller" whatever that is. But they brought a real fridge up for us for no extra so that was good. The bathroom was nice and big but it appeared that the maid had not done her job properly. There were towels but no toilet paper! One roll was completely empty and the other almost empty. We had to ring down for more. There was also no bath soap only one for the sink. I really don't think this is acceptable for a hotel in this price range. My daughter used the pool and spa. The pool is very small and the spa even smaller. I don't think you could've fit 2 people in there! There were workmen in the fitness room and we had to dodge wires hanging from the ceiling each time we went through to the pool. Not good. Aside from these small things, I'd probably stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sterile but right price”
Reviews.Author: teachers55
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a 7 pillows-on-the-bed hotel which at first glance seemed very nice, but our room had two major problems. We had luke warm to cool water in the shower - the water simply would not get hot - and the toilet did not flush properly. We worried every time we used it that it would overflow. We were only there one night so we didn't complain but we told the desk about the problems when we checked out. The staff was friendly and helpful - gave us a wine opener at no charge. The bedding was first class. We booked through priceline and got a terrific discount -- bid was $72 plus tax to a final bill of $88. We turned in our car before going to the hotel so we didn't have to pay the high cost parking and the shuttle the next morning was on time, no problem. In fact, the rental car shuttle delivered us directly to the hotel which was handy. We'd stay there again for an early morning flight - especially with the same priceline bid - but we'd check the toilet and shower before unpacking in case we needed to change rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here on recommendation and wasn't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: littev0ices
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a single night as we wanted to get out of LA easily the next day down Highway 1 - I'm a Marriott platinum member so tend to get better treatment than the average guest so bear this in mind with my review. I was staying on points and had read about this hotel on tripadvisor/other sites as being one of the best Marriottâ€™s in LA - hence deciding to stay here for the night in question - we we're disappointed. Arrived and found the hotel easily, put our car into the parking garage (cost about $23/night with check in/out privileges). Check-in was a breeze, pleasant receptionist thanking me for choosing their hotel etc, made me feel very at home and happy. Lobby also looked nice. Our room was on the club floor (11), and had a nice view of the airport (as requested prior to check-in so that was noted and acted upon). The room had a nice flat screen high def TV and the usual great Marriott bed. Felt at home and enjoyed the nice bathroom too -although huge disappointment that later in the evening there was no hot water, so no bath, we didn't report the problem though as we didn't want to watch someone fixing it late in the evening. It was working by the next day. We had arrived a little late (~8pm) and after freshening up went to the club lounge to try 'deserts', which were very tasty (and free). The prices in the club lounge aren't cheap I admit, but, the offer of cocktails for about $9 isn't too bad for this class of hotel imho, whilst you can enjoy watching the planes land. For food there wasn't anything nearby apart from a Burger King across the road, as such we asked in the club lounge for a recommendation for a nice Italian. They gave us a name of one a short drive away - it was tasty, and it was also Zagat rated we noticed, so definitely a positive recommendation from the staff. Next morning we checked out and left, but, had a good time overall and if I was near LAX in the future I'd try and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Sharp & modern room decor, but a few things could be improved...”
Reviews.Author: LKWLongBeach_CA
Reviews.Content: The large, remodeled rooms on the club floors are great. Decor is W Hotel style - clean and modern. Upscale touches include Cigar Afficionado, Golf Digest & Wine Enthusiast magazines. Lather brand bath products. New carpet, quality bed linens, Two CD/IPOD-capable clock/radios. Soundproof windows, sitting area, 2 TVs (one plasma). Writing desk with lighting & power/internet station, etc. That being said... We booked one night to attend a function being held at the hotel so we wouldn't have to drive the 30+ miles back home at midnight after the festivities. The 11th floor room with club lounge access was nice; but the hallway outside smelled like a 55 gallon drum of 90 weight transmission oil was hidden within a 10' radius. Perhaps the elevators were just serviced? It did remind me that I need to stop by JiffyLube this week to have my oil changed in the car... We booked the "Romance Package" for a few extra $$$ (a bottle of chilled champagne, chocolate-dipped strawberries & fresh rose petals sprinkled on the bed upon arrival)! Note: "Upon Arrival" means sometime after 6pm....no matter when you arrive (check-in starts at 3pm). We checked in at 4:30pm - no romance. We called front desk to check on romance's status, & were told we'd have it within 30 minutes. We went to the club lounge...hor's douvres start at 5:30 pm. Until then, there were plenty of sodas, bottled water and coffee/tea available, along with some not-quite-ripe pears. At 5:30, they set out some VERY nice appetizers (shot glasses filled w/veggie sticks, rice with curried chicken skewers, cute little gourmet cheese & dried fruit bowls with crackers). Drinks at the lounge were pricey, w/average wine going for $8.50/glass. Better wine was more. (Hint: the liquor store on the corner of 98th & Airport will sell you a BOTTLE of average wine for about the same $$$). After a quick hunger-satisfying snack, we returned to our room to dress for the evening's gala in one of the ballrooms. SURPRIZE!! A hotel staffer was "preparing" the Romance Package - Part I for us by lazily spreading rose petals on the bed. We all agreed that they were pretty, and smelled really nice. But, OK...some ambiance is definitely lost when you have to sit on the couch & chatting with and watching somebody prepare your room for "Romance". And this was only PART I of the romance thing....Part II was handled by "Mr. Catering Guy" who knocked at the door bearing said champage & strawberries 15 minutes after "Ms. Rose Petal" left with her empty rose-petal-holding-mini-suitcase. In the meantime, since romance was on hold for a spell, we turned on the plasma TV to catch up on the day's affairs. The sound on the TV set was amazing! The completely black picture, however, left something to be desired. A quick check of the cables & controls left us with the realization that this problem was over our heads and we'd need a professional to fix it. We finished dressing, and being cautious travelers, placed our valuables in the thoughtfully provided personal safe located in the top dressser drawer (great idea - beats having to crawl into the closet to find the safe, which is where most hotels place them). Just before leaving, we placed a call to the front desk lodging our TV repair request, and placed another in-person request with the Concierge on our way downstairs to attend the pre-gala cocktail party (just in case). Attendance at the cocktail party was great, but that also meant "crowded", with lots of bodies in little space (the hallway outside the banquet room). It got really hot, really fast. We decided to take short leave of the festivities and head back up to our room to enjoy a glass of cold champagne and a chocolate-dipped berry or two, because (as it was upstairs in the club lounge) a glass of mediocre wine was $8.50. Back at our rose petal festooned room, we found "Mr. Maintenance" carefully checking the plasma TV. He deduced that the tube was blown, and announced he was on the way downstairs to see if there was another TV around he could swap out. We advised him that we'd be there for about 20 minutes, so to come back after that, which he apparently did, as when we returned after 11:00 pm, the plasma was fixed. The last issue happened when we tried to access the thoughtfully-provided-and-easily-accessible-personal-safe containing our valuables, and found that no matter how many times we entered the carefully programmed personal code, the LED display returned a "ERROR90" message. Another call placed to the front desk requesting someone come by to fix obstinate electronic device resulted in yet another hotel staff member (this time from security) knocking on the door; this time at 11:45 pm, to reprogram the safe and rescue our belongings. While this seems like a lot of inconvenience...I can say the room itself was quite nice, the hor's douvres and the breakfast items were terrific - after we turned in the slight molded bagels in exchange for fresher, less green English Muffins. Recommend the management pay a bit of attention to quality checking the well-decorated and appointed rooms, and some time reviewing guest-preparation processes. This would go a long way toward making guest's stays more enjoyable. ....by the way. If you've booked a "club lounge" access room, may I recommend requesting Room 1125: most of the things that could go wrong in this room have already been fixed!

Reviews.Title: “Needed a hotel airport for a day”
Reviews.Author: JhonB
Reviews.Content: Flying into LA to catch a cruise and needed a place to stay overnight. The Hotel was as I expected for a Marriott. No surprises and most important of all no disappointments. Got a nice rate on a Marriott weekend getaway promotion. Ate dinner at the sports bar/restaurant at the Airport Marriott two blocks down, and breakfast at the hotel in between the two (Whoâ€™s name escapes me now) as we were not impressed with the restaurants at the Renaissance. On the end of our trip, the room would have cost twice as much, so opted to stay at a different hotel for the last night in LA, but only because of price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hazy-Sunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Montura for 2 nights in a suite on the concierge level. The suite was a good size and was very clean and comfortable with all the little touches you would expect from a 4 star. The service from the reception, concierge and staff in the club lounge was excellent and the food was good too. We particularly enjoyed the chocolate covered strawberries in our room. The hotel also has a small pool, jacuzzi and fitness room, which we didn't use but they looked very well maintained. Overall we were really pleased with our stay and everything about the hotel. For the price it is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance Montura”
Reviews.Author: Paula7928
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for $99 on the Marriott website for a Friday night. The hotel was beautiful with comfortable beds and nicely decorated rooms. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a Burger King across the street so you can save money on food. Hertz, Avis, and Budget are nearby also if you need to return a rental car. There is a well stocked gift shop in the lobby and I was impressed with how many different items they offered. The bellman who carried our luggage up brought us 3 bottles of complimentary water. Anytime we called down for extra towels or soap they were brought quickly. The hotel looks brand new and we really enjoyed staying there. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Time!”
Reviews.Author: TJDDevon
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 3 week self planned tour of the west coast with my husband and 11 year old son I feel I must compliment the Montura Hotel. We stayed for the first 4 nights of our adventure and our only problem were noisy neighbours on the first night. The next morning we mentioned it to the concierge when asking for info on the area ( all of which we got plus maps etc - extremely helpful) - within seconds she said the 'noisy' guests were here for a while and she would upgrade us to a Club room. The bedroom was a good size , comfortable with an attractive decor - bathroom was clean but not particularly stylish so could be updated to bring it more in line with the rest of the hotel, which had a luxurious feel with attractive artwork and sculptures. Couldn't hear any airport noise although we could see the planes coming in to land which my son found exciting. We used the self parking which was a little cheaper than the valet parking and just used an interior lift to get to the appropriate parking floor - no hassle at all. We had breakfast included and it was one of the best things we did - staff were polite, attentive and the cook makes a mean omelette - lots of choice. Well worth a visit. P.S. Used Trip Advisor to assist in the planning of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option in a central spot”
Reviews.Author: tofubeast
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here even though we weren't flying in an out of LAX. We got a nice rate for a great hotel, especially when comparing what the rates were going for with similar class hotels in other areas of L.A. Staff were friendly and quick during check-in. Self parking was included in our rate and was pretty easy breezy. The room was nicely appointed, with nice bed linens, marble counter-tops, and a flat screen tv. I was mostly impressed that we could not hear the airplanes at all. The room was nice and silent! We would not hesitate to say here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: wwills
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the LAX Renaissance as a quick place to stay after arriving late into LAX at the start of our trip. First, if you arrive late (after 11pm), their shuttle hardly ever shows up. We waited in the exhaust fumes for 30 mins before calling the hotel. All of the other hotel shuttles arrived - just not ours. When we called, they told us to book a cab and they would reimburse. Cab fare was $20 with tip. I asked the Cabbie when we got in if he took credit cards. He said "yep". When we arrived, he told me he did not take credit cards, and pointed to the ATM in the hotel lobby. Lobby is nice and clean and updated. It's very close to the airport. Hertz rentals is within walking distance (about two long blocks). The room is very small and has a musty smell. The A/C barely kept the room warmish-cool. The bathroom was worn out and old, but not dirty. The staff was generally nice and efficient though it took me a few calls to get extra pillows and towels. Internet is available for a cost. It's generally pretty quiet. So I would recommend it for a no-frills, but expensive, one night stay after or before a flight at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: jo1970Singapore
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel after a 16 hour non-stop flight from Asia. Picked up a rental car so can not comment on the shuttle service but did notice that there seemed to be more shuttle buses for the hotels than some of the rental car companies. Good sized room with a very comfortable bed. Older style bathroom but certainly clean and plenty of towels. Paid the extra for the Club level but didn't use many of the extras as we got in late and left v early. Low noise level given how close to LAX the hotel is, allowing us to get a good nights sleep. Room service food was excellent but huge serving sizes. Corona's were expesnive even for US hotel prices, but you pay for the convenience of room delivery with a smile. The only downside was that the room rate supposedly included 8 bottles of water which would have been handy for the early morning drive. However, the check-out desk staff had no idea what I was talking about even though I'd called down 2 minutes earlier and I'd been told to collect them from the front desk by another staff member. Given it was before 6am I couldn't be bothered arguing and tracking down whom I'd spoken with.... and hit the road. Overall, I'd stay there again but could not say I loved it. However, it is a great airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful Staff, Great Food, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: alindseyfinale
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother-in-law, and I stayed at this hotel while traveling to CA to get married. We stayed four nights/ five days, and loved it! Realistically, the shuttle was a little slow because of the sheer volume of people it had to pick up, and drop off, but the Valet Parking was awesome, and affordable at just $25/per day. Once we arrived, the check-in was fast, and the ammentities were terrific. The bed was SO comfortable! One night we were stuck in traffic for so long, that we were unable to get to any open restaurants, and decided to do room service. After a certain time, the hotel menu drops down to about 4 items, and I wanted some real food! I called the kitchen, and they told me to order whatever we wanted, and they'd fix it. They were so sweet. The hotel food is quite expensive but SO good, and I'm a very picky eater. After getting married on the beach in Santa Barbara, we arrived back to our room to find fresh rose petals all over the floor and bed, as well as chilled champagne, 2 champagne flutes garnished with strawberries, and chocolate covered strawberries! It was such a nice surprise. The staff came in and cleaned at whatever time we specified, which were always really "odd" hours, and never interrupted our sleep. Every night their was a "turn down" service when we returned from our destination, and it made our stay even more special. Added Suggestion: Make sure to get the "Club Level" room package so that you have access to the Conceirge Lounge. They provide breakfast, hors d'eurves, dessert, soda, coffee, hot chocolate, and water that is completely complimentary. It's not open all day long, but it is open several hours at a time. It was fun to get to try different things. It's worth a little extra money per night. Hope you have as good a time as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myscreenname29
Reviews.Content: Despite pratically being on the runway, the plane noise is not bad at all, and I am sensitive to noise. Rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. Staff was nice. Food was good. Great business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth_C95
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights while attending a conference at the hotel. The rooms were very nice and very clean. The furniture was pleasant and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was typical for a hotel of this type. Internet access was $12.95/day including local phone calls. It worked well. There was a flat panel tv with a decent selection of channels. The pool was nice, but needed heating. There is a nice fitness center and also a hot tub. Check-in was easy and most employees were polite. The restaurant was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in LAX Area”
Reviews.Author: TravelThom
Reviews.Content: After reading several mixed reviews I was a bit worried about my recent stay at this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised however that this hotel exceeded all of my expectations. The hotel has ample self parking, which at $28.00 is more reasonable then most hotels in the area. The front desk staff was cheerful and upgraded me to a beautiful suite on the conceierge level. The room was freshly decorated and had new decor. I was steps away from the concierge lounge which had the most delicious desserts and coffees. All in all this hotel was a pleasant end to my business week and I will most likely book it again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “This is well worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: Pala49
Reviews.Content: this is a very professional hotel and of very good quality...there is simply nothing wrong with it..although for some people its location as an "airport" hotel and therefore some distance from eating locations might be viewed as a negative. We stayed there 4 nights and found that catching the shuttle ..which runs every 15 minutes..to LAX ..enabled us then to hook onto the Flyaway which for $8 return will take you to 3 significant destinations..Union Station, Westwood and one other from which you can connect tolocal public transport..most notably the metro at Union station.. You can also get to Santa Monica by connecting on the Blue bus. Back to the hotel itself..the room was very clean and well cleaned each day..the facilities were of a level where any improvement would largely be a waste of money.. we simply had no issues with the place other than to say we definitely enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Lax hotel”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianStyle808
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel close to LAX Room was very clean and comfortable. Becareful of the nickel and dime expences (parking, internet, water, etc), we got a pkg with parking incl. One nice thing was an empty fridge (they will fill for you if you want) instead of a minibar. Gym was small but functional and there was a small pool area. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Terrible Airport”
Reviews.Author: TonyCardenas
Reviews.Content: we have had great experiences staying at Renaissance Hotels , mostly in Europe and when we searched for a hotel in the Los Angeles Area very close to the beach cities and high wayaccesible , that also offered a nice week end rate we came to pick the Montura hotel , we stay here for 3 nights and found a nice hotel quite impersonal quite comfortable (beds were very nice ) everythig seemed to work fine but it just felt like any first class hotel of middle age , but still just to stay close to LAX the rooms were very quiet even they were just by the run ways , breakfast was good every morning but they offerd the same food , swiming pool and gym were quite small and un atractive , the bar at the lobby served a very smart wine selection but the attendants were quite slow and distant . we had a very late flight out of LAX and the girl at front desk allowed us to stay till 4.00 pm (that was very nice )

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop-Over Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westernfb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here a couple of nights before leaving for Singapore in early April '08. It is situated just shy of being in a flight-path for LAX. The surrounding area is pretty much a rental-car wasteland. Nothing of significance is within close, walking distance. The only two dining options within walking distance are the hotel's offerings or a Burger King directly across the street. We ate dinner at one of the small number of tables included in the "bar". Drinks were a bit on the pricey side for us (what's up with wine prices these days??), and the food itself a bit less so, but the staff were very friendly, and the food was pretty tasty and creatively presented. In spite of our proximity to a flight path, our room was surprisingly quiet. It was also small, but clean, modern and comfortable. I can't remember offhand how much we paid, but I booked it through Hotwire and remember thinking that it was a very good deal for the money. I would give it a definite thumbs-up for a stop-over hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place for a lay-over”
Reviews.Author: fuhyong
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night here on a lay-over from SIN-LAX and LAX-MOB to break up what would have been a totally unbearable journey. Transport was free by courtesy shuttle from LAX to the hotel. To catch it, you have to go out of the airport onto the curb following the signs for hotel courtesy shuttle and just wait around for the bus that flashes marriott/renaissance to pull up. It's a short 5 minutes journey from the airport to the hotel, dropping off at Marriott first. Room was large, comfortable beds with an over surplus of pillows. not that I am going to complain of course. Although I booked for a breakfast to be included in the room rates, my next day flight was too early for me to consume it at a reasonable time so the front counter was kind enough to convert it to free internet access at no extra charge. The room only comes with a shower and no tub. A shower curtain prevents you from wetting the other parts of the bathroom but doesn't stop the water from flowing outwards especially if you have it running at speed for a while. The room was very well sound proofed and although you can see planes landing about a kilometer away, you can't hear them. I spoted a burger king next to the hotel. there are restaurants on the ground but I did not avail my self to them, choosing instead to turn in early for the next day flight. Next morning was a breezy check out followed by the same easy shuttle ride to my connecting flight. It happens that the bus pulled up immediately when I got to the lobby so there was no waiting time needed at all! All in, plenty good hotel. will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTex
Reviews.Content: We were moving from the U.S. (Texas) to Australia and wanted to overnight in Los Angeles the night before our long flight to Australia. We selected the Renaissance Montura based on price and revues, plus I'm a Marriott member. We couldn't have made a better choice. The hotel is only a few minutes from Los Angeles Airport, and provides a free shuttle. The hotel interior is beautiful, as was our room. We had dinner, and lunch the following day, in the lobby bar. The halibut we had for dinner and the duck quesadillas we had for lunch the next day were both delicious and beautifully presented. The quesadillas had a hint of banana in them - sounds funny, but it made for a wonderful taste combination. We sat around the hotel lobby from a late checkout time of 3 PM until about 7 PM when we left for the airport , reading and chatting, and thoroughly enjoying our time there. The staff and everything about the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven After A Sleepless Trans-Pacific Flight!”
Reviews.Author: FrancisUrquhart
Reviews.Content: we checked in at the Renaissance after a sleepless trans-Pacific flight from Sydney to LA. Though we arrived at 11:00 am, early check-in was no problem. Our room was really comfortable, very attractively decorated, extremely quiet, and moderately spacious. We even had a very large LCD flat panel TV. Everyone was super friendly and efficient from the moment we arrived. We forgot to ask for a portacot for our toddler; the smiling bellman arrived within two minutes. Not enough towels, another smiling bellman arrived within five minutes. The bed was incredibly comfortable and we all immediately fell into bed for 3-1/2 hours of a blissful nap after the aforementioned sleepless flight. We heard absolutely no airport noise, though my toddler daughter was delighted to be able to watch the planes come and go out of our window. The food in the cafe was excellent (though just a bit pricey) and the staff there were exceedingly kind and efficient there as well. Seeing our toddler they made sure to bring out our food quickly, which we greatly appreciated. They even brought us complimentary chocolate covered strawberries for dessert. We booked our stay through my corporate travel agent for $118 per night plus tax and would stay here again in a heartbeat. An excellent experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the shuttle ...”
Reviews.Author: Vaux
Reviews.Content: I used this an overnight airport hotel, arriving late evening and leaving very early in the morning so experience was limited. I just missed the shuttle leaving LAX - I saw it drive off as I exited the terminal building - and had a rather long wait for the next one. Probably about 20-25 minutes. I wish I had just taken a taxi. On arrival all was put right as I found that despite being a mere Marriott Silver card holder I had been upgraded to a suite. Loads of space, adequately furnished but in the typical Marriott style (i.e. I would not choose this for my own residence!). Great soft comfy bed though, just what I needed after a TATL flight. Triple glazing worked well to insulate the airport noise. Or at least, until the air-con switched itself on, damaged motor, sounded like a bus starting up. It was not hot so I just turned it off: I was in the wrong timezone to bother making a complaint to the front desk. I didn't bother with breakfast the next day and the shuttle back to LAX was prompt. My late late surprise was an email survey I received from the hotel after the visit, I filled it in and mentioned the air-con problem. Shall we just say that the hotel delighted me with an excellent service recovery.

Reviews.Title: “Only a quick stay, but one of the best parts of my trip”
Reviews.Author: sneakyshrimp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance for just one night, after a flight delay. My stay there was fantastic though and made up for terrible travel issues earlier in the day. I checked in late at night and the staff was very fast and friendly. The room was beautiful and very comfortable. The bed was excellent, although the towels could have been a bit shofter. Great shower and water pressure. For the price I paid ($129 including taxes) it was great. I was on the club level so a free breakfast was included. I'd definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a nice, reasonably-priced hotel near the airport. The one thing to keep in mind is that the hotel shuttle doesn't run very frequently at night...if you're coming in super late (I landed after midnight) you may want to think about taking a cab for the brief ride instead of waiting forever for a shuttle to show up.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: e_stire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after flying into LAX. The room was quite large as we were given a "handicap" suite. The bed was super comfortable. Everything in the room was very clean and tidy. You could hear planes out the window - wasn't loud enough to keep you awake and wasn't annoying but anywhere you stay right by an airport you will hear planes. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for LAX travelers and Hertz”
Reviews.Author: Boraxo
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms with nice furnishings. Much less noise than most of the properties on Century Blvd near LAX, and also avoids some of the traffic issues being off the main drag (but just as close to the airport). The bedding and towels were average and room service was okay. The gyms was nice too. Alas, the neighborhood isn't great so there was a little noise from the nearby police activity. But the hotel itself is safe. There is a Burger King across the street, and Hertz is walking distance - great way to avoid parking fees. On the minus side, the pool was too small, the convenience store is mediocre, and hotel failed to assign us to a Marriott elite floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 24h stopover”
Reviews.Author: sydneysooz_family
Reviews.Content: We wanted an airport hotel for our mid-evening arrival and departure 24 hours later. I chose this hotel for our young family (3yrs and 11months) based on the reviews and free Manhattan Beach bus and we were very happy with our stay and the exceptional service we received. We had a 15 minute wait (at 6.30pm on a Sunday night) for the shuttle pickup which was empty when we boarded at SouthWest. Checkin was easy and quiet. We had a Club room with 2 queen beds a cot/crib. It was a little tight all round but clean and pleasant enough. We got the kids into the bath straightaway, with their yelps of delight and play. As we were ordering room service (about 7.30pm) the Customer Service Manager came onto the line and very pleasantly told us that he'd had a complaint about the noise from the kids. We explained we had had them in the bath and were rushing them to bed after a bite, so it would be quiet soon (they are pretty good kids and seasoned travellers). He offered us COMPLIMENTARY cookies and milk for the kids (and our own drinks with the meal were complimentary) to entice them to bed. How many places can you go where you get complimentary drinks for a complaint against you??? Anyway it was a hit with us all. Room service dinner was good all around, my crabcakes were yummy and memorable and the kids meals were good too. We all had a good nights sleep - great blackout curtains, no noise from the airport (we were facing), comfy beds. Club Breakfast was okay and the kids were thrilled to see the low-flying planes in front of the club lounge! Snacks through the day consisted of fruit and sweets. The Club lounge is always a great place to escape from kids in a hotel room. We organised an extra 4 hours accomodation (50% rate I think to 6pm) and all headed out to Manhattan Beach - the main reason I chose the Hotel was for its proximity to the free bus (that'd I read about on Trip Advisor). DH and the kids spent the best part of the day at the beach and I spent time and money at the Manhattan Beach Mall. Concierge was very helpful with directions and what to do in Manhattan Beach. Check out and transfers were easy. We checked our emails (at a small cost) before the quick and easy transfer to the Virgin Terminal. Overall it was a really good choice for the airport area and the service was exemplary. We didn't get a ultracheap deal on the room as we would have liked at last minute (it wasn't much cheaper than the deal at the Sofitel LA), but the service more than compensated.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: aferraro
Reviews.Content: stayed here in transit heading back to Oz. As per their website, picked up the blue bus at the airport. The room was a little larger than we expected; we were on the 8th floor over looking Burger King and the airport. There is no mini bar fridge, however there is an ice machine and soft drinks machine is on every floor. The ice is free. The room was excellent value for money, and a bus stop for the number 3 big blue bus is nearby, which goes to santa monica. The room was soundproofed, so we were not distracted by airplane noise as long as we kept the windows shut.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonjonsc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property 3 nights for an in-house conference. Check-in was relatively quick and painless. I stayed in a junior suite on the third floor and was more than pleased with the room. There was not a single fault with the cleanliness of the room-- so this is the most important thing in considering this hotel! The bed was very comfortable and was dressed in nice linens and a fluffy duvet. You cannot hear a lot of airport noise, which is a plus at this type of hotel, but there were some other noises that were unidentifiable that did awake me the first night. The major problem I found with the hotel was that my room did not have truly hot water. At any time, it did not rise above tepid. In fact, one morning, I could not get it even warm enough to take a "Navy-style" soap-and-rinse shower. Maintenance was quick on the draw, but the problem was not fixed. It seems odd that no one else would have complained about this, but this was the only major problem for which I could fault my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Helenewe
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again. We booked the club level and our first room was small that our suitcases (2 of therm) could not fit. When we changed rooms, it was larger but the air conditioner kept us up all night. It would cycle on and off all night making lous noises. We couldn't sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal in Los Angeles!”
Reviews.Author: katsnme
Reviews.Content: I do my homework and it usually takes me a full month to search out the very best deal wherever we travel to. It was Labor Day weekend when most if not all hotels raise their rates sky high. I kept coming back to the airport area for lower rates and the Renaissance Montura LAX had the best deal going - about $95 per night! And to make it even better - the hotel honored their guarantee that if you find a cheaper price on any other travel site they will give you a lower price. I found it for less on Expedia and the room rate was lowered to about $68 per night! Now the Renaissance chain is a Marriott hotel so they have a fabulous bed which is wonderful. We got in late Friday night from San Francisco and were received with excellent hospitality, smiling faces and easy check in. We were even upgraded to a higher floor and more expensive room with a 'club' to go to for snacks, breakfast bar if wanted and a quiet place to relax with coffee or a glass of wine in the early evening. The room was clean, had a great view and flat screen t. v. which was great. Good shower and super clean bathroom! I am exceedingly fussy about a clean bathroom in hotels. The restaurant has fabulous food and wonderful breakfast. So, watch this hotel for a great price for high quality. You do have to pay for parking and internet connection daily - so remember to add that extra $27.95 in when you budget your travel plans. It is also is right at the airport with a free shuttle which is so helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Transit”
Reviews.Author: timsonic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel overnight after flying in from Montreal, with a single overnight stay before flying back home to Sydney Australia. My expectations were delivered exactly after reading the reviews here. I successfully caught the free shuttle from LAX, check-in was easy...the clerk even changed my room to one a little bigger, and even gave me a late check-out as my flight next day was not until 10pm. Dinner in the bar was OK, and I was even entertained by the conversation boucing back and forth among the patrons. This is a well used hotel, and used almost exclusively for over night stays between flights. It's best to expect no more than that, but this hotel delivers a little better than most. My room only cost $99 and I was very well satisfied. Given the friendships I struck at the bar, I was sorry to leave the next day. The free shuttle back to LAX arrived as expected, although I do tend to leave for the airport very early to ensure no delays. I would stay here again for transit convenience, but it's not a hotel to stay in as a base for seeing LA.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, plush bed, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: VicChick4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Renaissance for the last night of our honeymoon, as our flight from Jamaica came in too late to book a connecting flight back to Seattle. For $99, our expectations were definitely exceeded, and we would recommend this hotel to anyone! We arrived after 11 p.m., exhausted, and were pleasantly surprised to find out we'd been upgraded to a suite. The suite was huge and shaped like a rectangle. The separate sitting area, desk and old school TV were on one end, but that area was the farther from the window so rather dark. The restroom was in the middle of the suite, along with an empty fridge (no minibar but the sign said they could stock it for you) and a big mirror, good for getting ready while the husband was in the shower the next day. The king size bed was luxurious, and we appreciated the huge flat screen TV in that area of the room. We had a view of the airport and Burger King from our 6th floor room. One odd thing, the room had one bathrobe and one bottle of water, as if it was set up for one traveller even though we'd noted there were two of us on the reservation...but no big deal. The only slight drawback was speed of service in the lounge. We went down at 11:20 p.m. for a quick bite as we hadn't eaten since 4 p.m., and it took our food (an average club sandwich) 45 minutes to come. There were maybe eight people in the lounge so I'm not sure what the problem was, but the server apologized. Overall, for the incredible value we would definitely stay here again if we have to fly in/out of LAX. One nice perk, we are Marriott Silver Elite members and they recognized us with a coupon for a free latte in the morning. This was definitely one of the nicer Marriott brand hotels we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations far exceeded! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: indianrediff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days (joining my wife who had already been there for 3 days). The hotel is very conveniently located for travelers, about half a mile from the airport. It includes free transportation from/to the airport to/from the hotel. Be prepared to pay for parking - about $10 per day. The valet parking is definitely not worth it - unless you like to be pampered. I didn't even check the price. The location of the hotel was surprisingly good. The airport's proximity had to be seen to be believed - the planes could not be heard at all. The check-in process was smooth. We had arrived by a late night flight that turned into a very early morning flight - around 2 AM. The staff were courteous, helped get the luggage to our room and we settled in. The room itself was spacious. It was *not* the suite and yet we could place a rollaway bed in the room and have space left for walking around. The rollaway beds were nice too - not the folfing variety, but a stand-on-end variety that meant that the mattress was no too soft or springy. The bed itself (important for people with delicate backs) was not the best. I have slept on better beds. The bed (King size) was too springy. I would (almost) gladly have slept on the floor. The rooms were surprisingly well sound proofed. My wife liked the 2nd floor exercise space - I myself worked out in the room itself (5BX requires surprisingly less space - look it up on Wikipedia), and my kids liked the swimming pool which they used once and even then it was too cold. On the whole, we had a great time and liked the hotel as a place to access the best things in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance!”
Reviews.Author: moon-mouse
Reviews.Content: WOW, what a hotel. When we made this reservations we figured that an airport hotel would be noisy and dirty... this was neither! This hotel was far enough away from the airport that you didn't realize you were next to it. The room was fantastic! What a bed! Bathroom was clean and bath products were lovely. Coffee in the room, no breakfast included. On-site restaruant was expensive, but the food was good. Concierge give us a great recommendation for breakfast in Manhattan Beach called ?? Front desk staff needs a lot of work. I called to arrange an early check in prior to noon and they were nasty about it being a "first come first serve basis". When I called to cancel the request due to a snow storm, the reiterated that there was no request made and it was first come, first served anyway. Parking - be prepared to pay $20 to park! If this is what all Marriott Renaissance are like, we would stay at more! This is a luxury "airport" hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ray_yuen
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night in this hotel but it was very nice. There was a phone on either side of the bed and even one in the bathroom. There was an ethernet cable that we could connect our laptop. There was a 81 cm LCD TV with plenty of in house entertainment. I liked the express checkout using the TV. The buffet was really good at breakfast with a lady cooking our eggs fresh in a frying pan. If you wanted to save money there was a Hungry Jacks restuarant directly in front of the hotel. There wasn't anything else within walking distance so we hired a car with GPS. The lady at Hertz upgraded us free from the 'compact' we hired through Expedia to a medium sized car. The GPS unit are only in the mid sized cars and above. There are so many freeways in LA and the GPS made it easy to drive from Disneyland to Universal Studios and Hollywood. All the rent-a-car depots were in the same street as the hotel. This, combined with the hotel situated at LAX meant we could drop the car off and catch the free shuttle to the airport five minutes away. The rooms were immaculate but compact. We had free parking in the multi-level carpark behind the hotel. There were plenty of working 'pepsi machines' on each floor so the duty free alcohol was cheap to drink late at night. The room cost us $188 AUD for the night with breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Still one of only two LAX hotels for me!”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve had a couple of stays here, and the Montura continues to delight. Rooms sparkle, with Marriott Revive bedding. Toiletries are by Lather. High speed internet is at 100meg, although I had a couple of signal drops that were irritating on this visit. Front desk upgraded me to Club Floor (Silver Marriott status), which I was pleased with. When I got to the lounge (around 8:00p) most of the hot food was gone, but I had a couple of serviceable Buffalo wings and a glass of nice wine. Wine in the lounge is priced similarly to the restaurant at $8 to 12 per glass. I ate dinner in the restaurant, which was unusually busy. Service suffered a bit from slowness (it was a Saturday night), but the food was as good as always. The menu seems to have slimmed down a bitâ€¦ Breakfast in the lounge was nice. Plenty of breads and fruits, hot egg somethingorothers. Coffee available in go cups. There was a free access PC in the lounge for printing boarding passes. Lounge hint: They put out room temperature bottled water on the counter, but if you ask, they can produce well chilled sparkling water! When I transit LAX (usually en route to Asia) I only have my travel agent check the Montura and the Westin. This time, I got a $119 rate, so was really pleased. Plus, it may be the only airport hotel in the world with a substantive collection of artwork, nicely placed around the lobby and the buildingâ€¦ you donâ€™t find that at the LAX Marriott! Iâ€™ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The bedbugs enjoyed their stay more than we did”
Reviews.Author: 5*fan
Reviews.Content: We decided to break up a trip with a stay in LA following an overnight flight. While we appreciated the ability to get into our room when we arrived at the hotel, once we woke from our nap, we found that bedbugs were also guests in our room. When we notified the staff, the manager informed us that the Marriott Rewards points used for our stay would be recredited to our account. He also assured us that the exterminator would be called to rectify the situation. Since we have yet to receive our point credit (it has now been 2 months), I can only assume that the bedbugs are still feasting on weary Renaissance guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice near LAX”
Reviews.Author: am-ls
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Renaissance Motura hotel in september 2007 Neighborhood The hotel is just a stone's throw away from the runways of LAX. The neighborhoods around LAX can be a bit dodgy, and it typically gets worse the further away from the airport you get, especially to the east. This, however, is close to the airport, and I felt quite safe there. There are dozens of hotels nearby, Sheraton, Mariott, Hilton, etc. There's a Burger King just across the road from the hotel, for those looking for a cheap meal. Surrounding the hotel are the many giant car parks of LAX. Parking was charged extra, but with in-and-out-privileges for the day. Room The room I got was very, very good. Clean, spacious, modernly furnished. Extremely comfortable bed. A desk with a network cable for the computer. A flatscreen TV, huge minibar. This was a very nice surprise, far beyond what I expected. Maybe a bit 'too much' for what I was looking for: a comfortable place to sleep. Bathroom Bright, clean bathroom with a huge tub with shower. Very nice. Service I didn't really bother the staff much, but housekeeping did a very good job, and check-in/check-out was a breeze. Short summary This is a very good business hotel, with a standard that should be more than sufficient for most travellers. Close to the airport and close to the other major LAX hotels. This will serve you well if you're willing to spend the dough.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional one night stay”
Reviews.Author: BernieMaggie
Reviews.Content: I was booked at a compeitor's hotel a block away, but ran into quite a few problems there. I called the Renaissance, and they had just what we needed. Having stayed, and enjoyed, the Renaissance Montura before, I should have not chanced another hotel, but I thought the competitor would be better for my family. I was wrong. The reservations agent was very helpful, and the front desk staff, concierge, and bell staff couldn't have been more accomodating. We were given an upgrade to concierge level, which had a very nice selection of hors d'oeuvres in the evening and breakfast items. The lobby and bar area is bright, cheery, and inviting, Just what was needed after a long flight across the country. Rooms were clean and inviting, with flat panel TVs and very comfortable beds. The food (we ordered room service, and it arrived very hot in a nice warming unit) was very, very good. The menu is quite extensive, something for everyone. If you are flying in or out of LAX, I would recommend this hotel highly. It would be our first, and only, choice if we were to need accomodations in the LAX area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport accomodations”
Reviews.Author: R.ching
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay at this hotel. The room was spacious, quiet and easily accessible. The staff is great! Should be able to book for about $100 a nite. This does not include parking which is an additional $17 per day. Beware of the free airport shuttle. It's not a problem leaving the hotel to get back to the airport, if you try and catch it when you first arrive they sometimes get crowded and will pass you. I arrived at the United Airlines arrival area and two shuttles to the hotel passed me because they were full. Ended up catching a cab. Evidently United is at the end of the run.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlylover
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, nice decoration,good service,expensive parking,above average hotel, yes i will go back on my next trip,good transportation service to the airport, and very good rate $99 dlls.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance LAX = Nice”
Reviews.Author: Brklynrider
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel on a return trip to Los Angeles. I needed to stay near LAX for a quick overnight trip. In October I stayed at the nearby Marriott LAX which was very expensive and they didn't have their act together. This hotel, on the other hand, is very nice and much cheaper too. It also seemed much more relaxed and less convention like. The lobby wasn't noisy or too busy. The restaurant had a well above average wine list - much to my surprise. The hotel is a little gem at LAX. My stay was over a Friday night so I had a $99 (the Marriott was $119) weekend rate which is very reasonable price. The room was very spacious and had a large bathroom and the new-Marriott beds. The room also offered a Ipod radio as well as cd player, plus free bottles of water. Very nice touch. Being a Marriott Rewards member I was granted access to the concierge lounge which, I must say, was fantastic. This place offered well above the average appetizers including poached salmon, various cheeses, meatballs, etc. The hotel also has a cute-little gift shop and great gym (also outdoor pool if you have the time). I was on the 5:30 am airport shuttle and the shuttle (which also picks up people at the Marriott) was right on time and was a short 10 minute ride to my airline at LAX. This hotel is very nice an I highly recommend it if you need to stay near LAX airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight layover”
Reviews.Author: BanaPona
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at the Montura on the bookends of our trip - after and before long flights from/to Asia. Overall, the hotel is good for an overnight layover, but I would not stay longer. The airport shuttle bus service was excellent during our two stays - the bus runs in 15-min intervals and was pretty time efficient for service to this hotel. The close proximity to LAX is a big plus for fliers. The staff were pretty good, with the possible exception was the maids during the afternoon during our second stay - talking/yelling loudly in the hall to communicate - you would think that they would be more cautious being an airport-area hotel. The room service was pretty good - reasonably priced and some creative dishes. The room was fairly large and gave a decent sense of space. The bed was really nice, but the furnishings were a bit old - yet well-maintained and very clean. Two flaws: the water temperature of the shower was bothersome - e.g., taking a long time to get hot and needing frequent adjustments. Also, the room is pretty dark - - natural light did not get in too much and the in-room lighting was not very bright. Staying overnight the first time, we did not notice this - we just wanted to sleep after a 14-hour flight. It was more noticeable during our second stay. I would not really like to stay or work in such a dark room ..... so overall, a good lay-over hotel but probably not for longer.

Reviews.Title: “A superb deal for LAX”
Reviews.Author: Roadboy
Reviews.Content: Just a one-night stay, but we were very impressed with the all-round quality of this airport hotel. Despite a bargain rate, we were given a junior suite - which had had a stylish recent makeover. And the restaurant, although rather lacking in atmosphere on a Saturday night, served up remarkably good, innovative food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in the City of Angels”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotterColorado
Reviews.Content: My sis and I stayed here 3 nights for a long weekend, returning home yesterday. After doing much research, I chose the package with this hotel because I liked the fact it was close to the airport. We had no problems! Some of the reviews were horrible, and we were a little freaked. But I think those reviews really boiled down to the fact that some people like to complain about everything. Sure, the bathroom sinks and showers are a little worn around the drains. Big deal! Water runs there on a regular basis. Our room was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping left plenty of towels everyday (more than we could use), obviously cleaned the shower everyday (our bottles were always moved), and even folded the facial tissue into a rose every time they came to service the room. The large flat-screen TVs, updated carpeting, and tasteful furniture did not even hint at what some people referred to as a â€œdatedâ€� hotel. The bar/restaurant staff was excellent both nights we were thereâ€”efficient and very friendly. The $15 steak sandwich was gross and left a lot to be desired but that was the only negative. Even though the valet is contracted out, the staff was friendly there as well. We were in town for a writing workshop, but still drove all around Melrose, Santa Monica, Sunset, Hollywood, Wilshire, etc. The complaints that the hotel wasnâ€™t close to anything didnâ€™t seem to affect us either, as most places we went were no more than 20 minutes away (assuming there wasnâ€™t a great deal of traffic). Iâ€™ve traveled all over the world, staying in 5 star resorts where the service is impeccable so I have high standards. I have no complaints about the Renaissance Monturaâ€”much nicer than I would expect for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Deserved my return”
Reviews.Author: yrtx4e
Reviews.Content: I had to have meeting near LAX. After reading the reviews and client suggestions. I booked into the club level room for two nights end of Nov. A reception staff named Kia almost spoiled my trust in the Marriott group which I used to stay throughout my travel in Asia , Europe and N. America. This female staff had a lot of screw-ups when I called directly to the hotel to made changes to my online reservation. She was extremely impatient and caused me time by calling the LA regional reservation center to reconfirm the wrong info she told me.the system. To my surprise, she misled my niece that the rateI booked was not on Club level and wasn't entitled to club lounge facilities when My niece checked in- who arrived one day earlier than I did.. I went to meeting right after I arrived at LAX from an international flight. I didn't return to the hotel late after 9pm to get to enquire about the discrepancy against my reservations. I was delighted the Renaissance Montura has a capable Front Desdk Manger - Peter Choi. Mr Choi upon checking on my reservation and instantly offered apology to the mishandling of my reservation. He made adjustment to the room rate for the first night which my niece didn't have the club level facilities. He rectified our key card to ensure we had the club level facilities even we were not on the club level which I was still willing to pay for the club room rate instead of moving. I was impressed with the professionalism of Mr. Choi. Apart from this flaw, the rest of the hotel staff are hospital and helpful. The hotel shuttle runs aroiund LAX every 15-20 mins. witha friendly bux driver. The hotel is closed to car rental base, and the shuttle stop to Manhattan Beach Mall which is the closest quality mall in the area. Four Point Sheraton is right next door, Don't drive into the wrong hotel =) Some review commented the hotel is dated. I was apparently not in a recently reburbished room. But it was spacious, clean and well maintained. The lobby is not as dated as some reviews. However, the lobby physical setting is a bit unorthodox, the reception desk in in the far left corner, with a lounge area right at the entrance. For an Airport hotel, one can't expect a granduer spacious lobby with marble columns, it is still above average. I will return for the genunine Marriott hospitality extended by the Duty Front Desk Manager- Mr P. Choi.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: DonDonna20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renassaince Montura LAX for 2 nights enroute from London to NZ. We had a uniformly positive experience through out our stay, and I would recommend this property to others who have a similar length stopover in the LA area particularly between long haul flights. I can only imagine that some of the negative reviews of this hotel were down to one off poor circumstances ie: particular room defects, however comments on the the lobby and rooms being run down certainly in our experience of this hotel thankfully proved untrue. The shuttle bus runs 15 min intervals from LAX to hotel (light blue van with screen on side saying Renaissance & Marriot) located just outside baggage claim under a sign that says Hotel Transfers. It is only 5 mins to hotel which after a lengthy flight & wait at customs is divine! The lobby area is modern and classy, check in was a breeze and staff were friendly and accommodating from the concierge, porter to domestic staff. Our room was better than we anticipated, with a huge comfy bed, large flat screen TV, nice bathroom amenities (even quality miniature bath products). Our room looked out over LAX whose proximity initially worried me with noise, however we didnt hear a thing! A check out time of 1 pm was handy too as our flight was later that day - express check out via the TV system was easy & saved time. Burger King is located accross the road - and judging by the foot traffic I would say that it does a lot of patronage from Renaissance guests ! ha! Okay so it is located in LAX and away from major attractions, but LA itself is a sprawling area, so you are never going to stay in one place that has everything. It is close to Santa Monica - the bus transit centre is a 5 minute walk (75 cents to Santa Monica & $1.25 to downtown LA via bus). And if you want to venture further many of the tours available pick up from the LAX area. If you are perplexed with accommodation options in LA, and are coming off a long haul flight and want just a taste of LA, and to stay in a clean, reliable and fairly modern hotel then I would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “That 70's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chinagirl
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel, I happily reserved one night before we travelled to San Diego from Thailand. Upon entering the hotel, I knew that I would be disappointed. It was so old fashioned and "tired" as one reviewer pointed out. The lobby, lobby bar and restaurant was something from the 80s or perhaps 70s! I knew that the room itself wouldn't give any surprises... and I was right. How this hotel EVER got to no. 1 position for LAX is completely beyond me. It just goes to show that you really cannot trust everything you read on Tripadvisor. Everyone has different standards and after living in Asia for many years, you really come to expect a certain standard and this hotel does not deserve no. 1 spot in my opinion. I also noticed that the Thai Air staff also reside at this hotel during there stopovers... I feel sorry for them! One thing I have to add at this point is that the staff are really really nice and friendly and this review is not based on them at all. The entire hotel needs basically knocking down and starting again. Too tired, too old, too musty and TOO expensive. I would never ever stay here again even if they offered me a room for free.....

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: travelprotectors
Reviews.Content: Exceeded expectations. Unless this was a fluke, everything went incredibly smoothly from catching the complimentary shuttle bus to a personal welcome greeting from the hotel manager as I entered the lobby. Check-in staff eagerly anticipated my approach way before I made my way to the counter AND made sure I knew exactly where I could find the elevators. Plus, if you are here on business, nothing beat the $9.95 (from noon to noon UNLIMITED HIGH SPEED INTERNET ACCESS, WITH FREE LOCAL AND LONG DISTANCE CALLING! I could sit at the desk with my lap top, check emails and make/return phone calls from the same desk with no worries about cell phone issues. It was a sheer delight. I would definitely consider this hotel again when I return to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was great and will be staying there again!”
Reviews.Author: willis2005
Reviews.Content: I was reading the last review on this hotel and I didn't agree at all. That is why I am writing this review. First of all, I am an experienced traveler and have stayed in many different places. My friend and I stayed here last December as an after Christmas getaway. I booked it on the Marriott website since I am a Marriott Points Member. I DID NOT find the property tired at all. Our room was gorgeous. Maybe we got a newly remodeled room but the lobby area was beautiful as well. Is it in a great location to L.A beside wanting to be near LAX? No, of course not. It is an Airport Hotel. The pool is okay and the exercise room was actually pretty nice. Please keep in mind this is an AIRPORT Hotel. However, it is very close to Santa Monica and Marina Del Rey where we went to dinner both nights. I loved it and will be going back again next month. I used to be an LA resident for 4 years and would highly recommend this hotel but if you know nothing about L.A it isn't near Disneyland or Universal Studios. If you want to be close to Disney, you need to stay in Anaheim and If you want to be near Universal you will have to stay in the Valley some where. You are out closer to the beach areas with this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport location, tired property”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a two night business trip as I needed close proximity to LAX. The hotel proximity to LAX is great. The facility is an older property that has lost some of it's shine. Our room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. Both the housekeepong and front desk staffs were efficent. While we found it to be a decent place to stay for a short trip, I would not recomend it as a base to explore the LA area. The pool area is dismal at best. Use it for business and early morning flights.

Reviews.Title: “Wife Loved It”
Reviews.Author: KlondikeMike
Reviews.Content: Moved from LA to Alaska, had to go back and work on our home while it was being rented. My wonderful wife didnâ€™t like that I picked the hotel (off the internet!!!!!), since she lived in LA for 20 years, but I used Alaska Airlines hotel reservation service and paid in advance. We checked in and she was surprised how nice the hotel was inside, outside was ok. Well, I never write reviews, a waste of time, but this hotel was great. We stayed on the club level, had continental breakfast and evening h'orderves at the concierges lounge. While walking by the maids we noticed, a of couple times, that they were scrubbing down the tile walls of the shower and taking out the down comforters and replacing them, these rooms were clean. All in all, my 5-star hotel loving wife really liked this place and for only $99.93 per night not including tax. As the governator says, "We will baaaack".

Reviews.Title: “Good quality LAX hotel”
Reviews.Author: SussexUKTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night on July 28th. The transfer bus from the airport was punctual. On arrival the reception desk member of staff was very friendly and told me they'd honoured my request for a high floor room. Very unusual that hotels even notice a request on an internet booking. I had booked the club lounge rate which provided us with snacks and breakfast. Breakfast was nice with a good view of the landing aircraft! Hotel is conveniently located for car rental compounds. We rented from Avis which is within walking distance. The pool and sauna were also good. Having stayed at the Hilton & Howard Johnson at LAX this is definitely the nicest and best value.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality, Complimentary Upgrade to Club Level”
Reviews.Author: al77059
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after my flight plans were changed. I've stayed here a couple of times before and each time the facilities have been excellent. I was even upgraded for free to the club level due to my flight change as well as my marriott rewards elite privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: joelaws
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. Staff totally disinterested. Room shabby - light bulbs broken, power points hanging off wall. Room service got order wrong twice, and both times when told of error failed to deliver missing order. Almost impossible to rouse staff on the phone. Cold shower. Shabby bathroom. Airconditioning noisiest I have ever encountered. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel - Slow Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: wallace9422
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one evening during a recent trip to the area. We stayed the night here as we had an early flight out the next morning and wanted a place close to LAX. The Pro's: This is a very impressive hotel, especially for being in the LAX area. The lobby is very modern and impressive and the rooms were very nice (flat screen TV's, large size, etc). If I had to stay in the LAX area, I would chose this hotel. The Con's: My only negative experience (which is why I gave the hotel 4 stars instead of 5) was with the shuttle service. We dropped our rental car off in the evening and took the Hertz shuttle back to the airport. We previously confirmed with the hotel their shuttle ran the airport route every 15-20 minutes. After 30 minutes, no shuttle. We called the hotel and the front desk insisted the shuttle ran every 15-20 minutes. After about 45 minutes standing by the curb waiting, the shuttle arrived. We were to the hotel in 5 minutes, but the wait at the airport dampened the moment. To give their credit, our wait in the morning to the airport was only about 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “King Bed for family of four???”
Reviews.Author: Martin35
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that we had no complaints with the hotel except for the fact that we were given a king bed for a family of four!!!!! I followed all the instructions perfectly to assure our needs would be met. I booked the hotel online and although I stated 2 adults & 2 children (ages 14 & 17) the online confirmation read: 1 room king or 2 queens. It also said that I was to call 2 days in advance if we were arriving late. I called the hotel directly 2 days in advance and advised that our flight was scheduled in at 10 pm and so we would be late arrivals. At that time I said we were a family of four with 2 teenage daughters and would need 2 queen beds. I was told "no problem, that information would be noted on our reservation". After a long day of travel across country and arriving at the hotel (close to 2 am on our body clocks) we were checked in and sent up to our room. Mind you, we were all standing at the check-in desk and my 17 year old daughter is 5'11'' and my husband 6'1". We got up to our room with all our luggage to find one king size bed. We dragged all our luggage back downstairs and the clerk went to get her manager who explained that "legally" thay did not have to honor our "request" for two beds and that was the last room in the hotel. A childsize cot was put in the small room which meant we couldn't even walk around to get ready in the morning and that was that. Won't be staying there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: agbest
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Montura on the last night of our Los Angeles vacation primarily so we could quickly get to the airport the next day. Overall, our stay was excellent. For only $99, we were upgraded to a suite which was large, well decorated, immaculate, and very comfortable. In hindsight, I'm sorry we didn't stay at this hotel longer. I highly recommend this property for anyone traveling to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overnight stop in LA”
Reviews.Author: RobertFlorida
Reviews.Content: We needed to overnight at a hotel near LAX on the way back to Florida from a lengthy stay in Australia and New Zealand. We booked the Renaissance Montura on the basis of its location (convenient to LAX by free shuttle) good price and favorable reviews. We were not disappointed. We arrived in early afternoon after a 10 hour overnight flight and were checked in in no more than 30 seconds. After an afternoon nap and swim, we had a light meal in the restaurant where the service was friendly and efficient. The room was clean and the elevator service speedy, even though the hotel was full. I would definitely stay here again. The Renaissance Montura provided a hassle free experience which was just what we needed after an exhausting overnight flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: us1087
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance LAX was a fantastic hotel. I arrived early from the East coast and requested early checking. The hotel staff was more than accomidating in helping me with this request. I found the property to be urban chic with great artwork, decor, photos, and lighting. The bed was great and the room was quite clean. I do get a bit annoyed with paying $17 for parking when most of the airport lots in the area have lower daily rates. They really ought to lower the rate for a guest. I ordered room service one morning and found the food to be delivered hot and fast. The menu was good for all diets and had a nice selection. Overall I found this place to be a fine choice for your airport hotel needs. It's also great for early morning departures from LAX. Give the place a try, you will not be disappointed. It's usually a few bucks cheaper than the Marriott that is a quarter mile down the road on Century Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, VERY NICE!”
Reviews.Author: love2travelCO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY nice. The staff were all friendly and very helpful. Our room was decorated beautifully. The beds were absolutely the best, extremely comfortable. We never once heard the airplanes, despite the 3 minute drive to the airport. The only thing we did not like, was during the weekdays, when the business people would leave thier rooms, we could hear them in the hallways and slamming their doors. Parking was a bit expensive $18/day. The location was great, close to the 405 and near gas stations, rental cars and shopping. We will definately return, especially because the room price was so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: trio77
Reviews.Content: Beautifully renovated hotel. Our rooms were very clean and the beds were so plush. Nice touches such as a rubber duckie in the shower, a rain showerhead and a curved shower curtain rod offering more shower room. Our room had a large flat screen TV and an iPod docking station. Very quiet in spite of being close to airport. The club level offered a nice continental breakfast, happy hour appetizers and an evening dessert. Roomy and light filled fitness center with 4 treadmills, a bike or two, an elliptical and separate weight room. The only feature missing from this hotel would be an on-site spa center offering massages, pedicures and facials.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: HIohana
Reviews.Content: Since we were arriving late in the evening from Reno, Nevada, thought it would be good to stay close to the airport to have a good nights rest. Found this hotel from trip advisors reviews. We did have some problems due to the a/c not working, though it was beyond the hotels control. After we arrived at 9:30PM, we caught the Marriott hotel shuttle to the hotel. It was crowded, so had to stand for the ride. The driver was very nice, but didn't understand English very well. We got out at the wrong Marriott hotel, but a passenger informed us that we weren't at the correct hotel, so hopped back on. Check in was a breeze, however they did not have a roll away bed as requested, but gave us an aero bed instead. It was great substitute. They gave us a high floor, as well as 2 full size beds which were requested. The problem was that the air conditioning was not working in the rooms so it was very difficult to sleep with the windows open and the planes taking off. At check out, I told them that we didn't have a very good night. They were apologetic, and when I asked for some sort of compensation, they gave a discount on the room, so we were appeased. The room was small, but efficient. The beds were very comfortable, and room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Superclose to LAX, but not noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: UMD_Grad_Student
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after immediately checking out of the Santa Monica Doubletree due to dissatisfaction. The Renaissance was much nicer, and less than half the price! Rooms were above average and included a refrigerator. Front desk staff recommended a good Mexican restaurant (Cozumel's) and was very efficient. Would absolutely stay here again if we needed to stay around LAX (5 mins to airport). Surprisingly, we were watching planes land all night and no one was awakened by the noise (windows must be extra-soundproof because we couldn't hear a thing!). Head south on Hwy 1 about 5 miles for great shopping, dining, and groceries (Whole Foods).

Reviews.Title: “Best Option for airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: a12548
Reviews.Content: Having an overnight stay from my long flight to Hong Kong, I always try to be careful where I stay when near LAX. For most part the hotels there are sub-par. Since I got a great special rate ($110) and read some good reviews here, I booked one night. The shuttle was excellent, coming every 15 minutes to LAX. The ride is only 10 minutes, check-in staff was really polite and helpful. The room was really nice, beds were excellent. My only problem was the decorative pillow had mysterious brown/ashy looking globs on it. Apparently they arent changed between guest stays. The video check out didnt work but was no big deal. The restaurant had some great food, try the Onion soup at night its a masterpiece. The shuttle back was flawless, the drivers lugged the luggage on board without disgusted looks. The staff seems like a good bunch. 5 stars but I subtract a star for the pillow globs. Id stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: chuggins68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as I had an early flight the next morning and needed something close to the airport. This property was disappointing for the 4.5 rating it earned on this site. Room 752 was a surprisingly small king room (maybe 3-4 ft between the end of the bed and the entrance door), hairs in the tub and the complimentary shampoo was missing (I had to call housekeeping to get some--the person to whom I spoke seemed bothered that I had called). This maybe ok for a short layover but I do not recommend it for the business traveler or family of 5. As a former hotel G.M. and frequent traveler I expected more out of a 4-star Renaissance. The Hampton Inn in Cypress, CA, was less expensive, much cleaner, more spacious, more accomodating (free wireless and breakfast), and the staff seemed more genuinely interested in making sure my stay was satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel For Everyone"”
Reviews.Author: CANADIAN2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night based on the "Trip Advisor" Reviews. Was not dissapointed. Great service and very close to the airport. Ask the conceirge for a list of nearby restaurants...they gave us a name of an Italian place that was one of the best we have eaten at!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: cchambers97
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking after I had just arrived into LAX, it was an overall excellent choice of a hotel. The location is great it near car rental (beware the parking per day is approx. 18usd); the hotel offers a complimentary shuttle. Although, I didnt dine in at the hotel there is a restaurant and a Burger King directly across the street. The bed slept very comfortable so at that rate I have no major complaints. No leaks,runs, or anything out of the ordinary. I have to say I was pleased and will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a LAX stopover”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Beylon
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night when connecting at LAX (Marc 31 st to April 1st 2007). Efficient and fast shuttle service from and to airport. Quick check-in and check-out. Comfortable room. Very good breakfast buffet. Good value for money. Only downside is pool (very small and located in an unpleasant courtyard). Eric Beylon

Reviews.Title: “excellent food,problems with room temp”
Reviews.Author: AilsaDelgadoMD
